questions: Commercial woodlands are _____ as property where timber from the forest is actively being marketed and sold.
full_sentence: Commercial woodlands are defined as property where timber from the forest is actively being marketed and sold.

questions: Newspaper and magazine readership figures - which advertisers place more importance on than sales - are _____ from interviews with consumers.
full_sentence: Newspaper and magazine readership figures - which advertisers place more importance on than sales - are derived from interviews with consumers.

questions: Ultimately, all public debt becomes the _____ of the private sector - manifested in rising taxation, a weakening currency and inflation.
full_sentence: Ultimately, all public debt becomes the liability of the private sector - manifested in rising taxation, a weakening currency and inflation.

questions: First acclaimed for his realistic portraits, John Sargent was later recognized for his _____ watercolors.
full_sentence: First acclaimed for his realistic portraits, John Sargent was later recognized for his impressionistic watercolors.

questions: _____ economies are establishing their own economic policies and trading patterns outside of the influence of industrialized economies.
full_sentence: Emerging economies are establishing their own economic policies and trading patterns outside of the influence of industrialized economies.

questions: Government leaders are attending the three-day summit to try and generate solutions to the _____ cost of commodities.
full_sentence: Government leaders are attending the three-day summit to try and generate solutions to the plummeting cost of commodities.

questions: The Democratic candidates want to raise the minimum wage and widen the safety net, _____ Republicans want to spur job creation by lowering taxes and shedding regulations.
full_sentence: The Democratic candidates want to raise the minimum wage and widen the safety net, while Republicans want to spur job creation by lowering taxes and shedding regulations.

questions: As I had _____ reading the newspaper, I began to think about the terrible accident.
full_sentence: As I had finished reading the newspaper, I began to think about the terrible accident.

questions: According to a recent McKinsey study, an average person spends 13 hours a week reading and replying to emails, a completely reactive activity, which is not part of anyone's job _____.
full_sentence: According to a recent McKinsey study, an average person spends 13 hours a week reading and replying to emails, a completely reactive activity, which is not part of anyone's job description.

questions: You can be _____ that this year's conference is the best place in the country for you to exhibit your merchandise.
full_sentence: You can be assured that this year's conference is the best place in the country for you to exhibit your merchandise.

questions: If you don't _____ waiting for ten minutes or so, I'll be able to see you at the lobby.
full_sentence: If you don't mind waiting for ten minutes or so, I'll be able to see you at the lobby.

questions: A woman can breastfeed in public discreetly _____ she has the right clothing, with appropriate nursing access.
full_sentence: A woman can breastfeed in public discreetly if she has the right clothing, with appropriate nursing access.

questions: If any retailer is caught _____ cigarettes to under-age children three times, they will not be allowed to continue retailing.
full_sentence: If any retailer is caught selling cigarettes to under-age children three times, they will not be allowed to continue retailing.

questions: In fact, with the S&P now no higher than in the last five months, we argue that the market is losing momentum and is now more _____ than since 2011.
full_sentence: In fact, with the S&P now no higher than in the last five months, we argue that the market is losing momentum and is now more vulnerable than since 2011.

questions: As a result of this outcome, we will need _____ the entire project a full month before we had initially planned.
full_sentence: As a result of this outcome, we will need to finish the entire project a full month before we had initially planned.

questions: If you _____, please mail this package.
full_sentence: If you are able to, please mail this package.

questions: The workers _____ the cargo from the ship.
full_sentence: The workers discharged the cargo from the ship.

questions: She has _____ knowledge of ancient Chinese history.
full_sentence: She has extensive knowledge of ancient Chinese history.

questions: The teacher had me _____ scales several times a day.
full_sentence: The teacher had me play scales several times a day.

questions: If they choose to spend this windfall on domestic consumption, then there is very good reason _____ the US economy will continue to muddle through quite nicely.
full_sentence: If they choose to spend this windfall on domestic consumption, then there is very good reason to believe the US economy will continue to muddle through quite nicely.

questions: There were so many reporters at the main gate, _____ were waiting for his arrival.
full_sentence: There were so many reporters at the main gate, who were waiting for his arrival.

questions: The movie producer was considering doing another film, _____ the last one was a disaster.
full_sentence: The movie producer was considering doing another film, even though the last one was a disaster.

questions: The drawing of a will may not be something we look forward to, but the _____ of one can create an incredible hardship on our loved ones.
full_sentence: The drawing of a will may not be something we look forward to, but the absence of one can create an incredible hardship on our loved ones.

questions: The Washington Post is now reportedly _____ content for users who block their ads, forcing them to sign up for a newsletter or subscribe to the site instead.
full_sentence: The Washington Post is now reportedly restricting content for users who block their ads, forcing them to sign up for a newsletter or subscribe to the site instead.

questions: Two tables and two chairs are included in the price of the space, but if you need additional equipment, there will be an _____ fee.
full_sentence: Two tables and two chairs are included in the price of the space, but if you need additional equipment, there will be an extra fee.

questions: The Brooklyn Bridge was built in the 1880's, when growing industrialization _____ a transportation boom.

questions: Clara Barton _____ the American National Red Cross in 1881 after serving in the International Red Cross in Europe.

questions: X-rays are able to pass through objects and thus make _____ details that are otherwise impossible to observe.

questions: The competitiveness of cities is evaluated in five main categories _____ human resources, business environment, infrastructure, access to financial markets and general competitiveness.

questions: The teacher told me that Francis had always enjoyed _____ English.

questions: I would appreciate _____ it a secret.

questions: Thank you again for your booth reservation. The annual Comic Book Conference in Los Angeles is expecting more than 25,000 comic fans _____ this year.

questions: The motor dealer wants to sell her cars quickly, so she's _____ special low prices.

questions: Taiwan enjoys having some foreign money because of the lasting trade imbalance, _____, larger export and less import.

questions: _____ built, with poor vision but excellent senses of smell and hearing, the bear will eat almost anything.

questions: An accumulation of wax in the ear canal may immobilize the eardrum, _____ a partial loss of hearing.

questions: Inaugurated a second time on March, 4, 1901, William McKinley looked forward to a new term _____ on domestic rather than foreign policies.

questions: Stepped-up consumer spending on autos and housing, and more investment by business, _____ for the spring bounce back.
full_sentence: Stepped-up consumer spending on autos and housing, and more investment by business, accounted for the spring bounce back.

questions: During the Middle Ages, to ensure good lucks, cats were often sealed alive in the walls of houses, convents, and public buildings, only _____ of suffocation.

questions: Prehistoric peoples had _____ caves to live in and a regular supply of water.

questions: In order to cope with the international market situation, the company will have to _____ some hard time.

questions: The senator's legislative record was too liberal to please his constituents; _____, they did not like his choice of a running mate.

questions: Treasury officials have privately indicated that they will not _____ to intervene if they discover that banks are behaving inappropriately.

questions: Demand for copper, particularly from China and India, has outstripped supply, which has been _____ by strikes and accidents.

questions: However, the optimistic economic forecasts are doubly significant in this case because higher growth means a lower _____.

questions: Abolish all import tariffs and all other quota and protectionism measures _____ to shield privileged domestic industries from competition.

questions: However, 20 minutes from the end of the film transcends into absolute utter nonsense and _____ disregards any notion of generic verisimilitude.

questions: Credit cards, store cards, overdrafts and loans were used to _____ goodies that old-fashioned wages could not deliver.

questions: The government is deliberately forcing this situation to rip _____ the poorest who imprudently saved during their working lives.

questions: The agencies also allege the energy company violated the Clean Air Act by improperly _____ asbestos-containing materials from its pipelines.

questions: _____ the country in a staggering amount of debt, people are questioning where future funding will come from.

questions: The housing market was a bubble created by banks giving silly _____ many multiples of average earnings.
full_sentence: The housing market was a bubble created by banks giving silly mortgages many multiples of average earnings.

questions: Avoiding deforestation and peat land destruction is cheap and can be _____ without huge investment in new technology.

questions: They will treat woodworm, reinforce the original piece and adapt it to your requirements with safety and practicality in _____.

questions: Would you please _____ how you calculated my loan payment?

questions: Existing landlords are expanding their property portfolios as house prices rise and demand from _____ continues to increase.

questions: _____ disposable incomes due to the spiraling costs of petrol, food and utility bills are likely to take the blame.

questions: The tropical rain forests of Central and South America support abundant wildlife, but the vegetation is too _____ for easy observation.

questions: That means your landlady must respect your rights and not do anything that will adversely affect your _____.

questions: The recession means that the jobs market is now _____ with skilled candidates looking to get back into work.

questions: Free movement of capital has _____ rapid shifts in cross-border capital flows, currency values and prices of commodities.

questions: The flower _____ well, but I did not water it.

questions: _____ a member of the civic association, you need to attend two meetings and pay your fees regularly.

questions: Employers believe that if workers stay at work _____, they may actually do more work.

questions: I wondered _____ he should be asked to come to the party.

questions: It is necessary that an applicant _____ in the form before January 13.

questions: We are now offering all of our current subscribers to Gold World a _____ discount on next year's subscription.

questions: We need to have better coordination of efforts to control illegal meat imports, and more _____ enforcement of personal imports and commercial shipments.

questions: Bank executives get so much flak from consumer _____ groups that they have become terribly sheepish about making profits.

questions: We will continue to support health _____ system strengthening and _____ HIV/AIDS prevention, care, control and mitigation programs.

questions: The topic of the meeting, _____ some of you might know, is inner city waste management solutions.

questions: That in turn means those councils may have to _____ rubbish in warehouses or even send material to landfill.

questions: The subject _____ I am interested is Business Administration.

questions: The unlisted company has expanded its workforce by 60 percent and invested in a _____ of new products.

questions: Prices fall in times of deflation, and this _____ in a rise in the demand for goods and services.

questions: _____ the situation requires more thought than he has given thus far.

questions: No bank keeps enough cash to pay all its _____ in full at one time.

questions: Get up a bit earlier, _____ you will become healthy.

questions: If this conflicts with anyone's schedule, please let my secretary or me _____ immediately.

questions: _____ nearly thirty years for the planet Saturn to complete one orbit.

questions: _____ penguins in the Arctic.

questions: To someone who is spiritless, the thought of participating in a contest is a _____ one.

questions: I believe we can _____ such difficulties when we do business sincerely and honestly.

questions: The government _____ to approve the use of widespread surveillance when the Justice Department took objections.

questions: When you stand outside the grounds, please remain on the sidewalks _____ not to damage the lawn.
full_sentence: When you stand outside the grounds, please remain on the sidewalks so as not to damage the lawn.

questions: I'll do my utmost in recommending some businessmen who will _____ the position.
full_sentence: I'll do my utmost in recommending some businessmen who will suite the position.

questions: According to designers, selecting works of art for display is neither an easy task _____ a glamorous occupation.

questions: A major issue at the Constitutional Convention of 1787 was the decision _____ the manner of electing the President.

questions: I think it is necessary for us _____ some further discussion.

questions: _____ you like to have lunch with us today?

questions: The _____ of migrant workers could also push up wages - an effect likely to prove a doubled-edged sword, Redwood said.

questions: He has lived in this country now for five years, but he makes no attempt _____ our language.
full_sentence: He has lived in this country now for five years, but he makes no attempt to speak our language.

questions: Since 1999, the G-20 has contributed to strengthen the international financial architecture and to _____ sustainable economic growth.
full_sentence: Since 1999, the G-20 has contributed to strengthen the international financial architecture and to foster sustainable economic growth.

questions: _____ the money he lent me, I could not have bought the new car.

questions: The hurricane, coming as it did, _____ the Florida coastal community by surprise.

questions: Your visit will be an excellent way _____ young members of your family to the exciting world of telecommunications.

questions: He tells me that they left New York in 1988 and _____ in Virginia since then.

questions: If he wants to get promotion, he _____ more interest in his work.

questions: Accounting _____ can be developed for any type of organization, not simply for profit-making concerns.

questions: This _____ population signals continued pains for already crowded area.

questions: I have to remind you that smoking in _____ areas of the company is not permitted.

questions: Please see _____ it that the goods not ordered are returned immediately.

questions: Traffic _____ costs this city's dwellers about 2 million dollars a year in lost time and fuel.

questions: The purpose of inductive logic is to _____ general laws from particular occurrences.

questions: After the careful investigation, I considered _____ the medicine to her.

questions: Tom _____ writing his letter because he had to leave for the hospital.

questions: Dr. Brown's new house needs _____.

questions: Marcus Alonzo Hanna made a _____ in the grocery, coal, and iron business.

questions: We were all _____ hard by the lack of jobs.
full_sentence: We were all hit hard by the lack of jobs.

questions: I am considering _____ your offer.
full_sentence: I am considering accepting your offer.

questions: Pollution affects much more people living in today's society than it did _____ in previous years.
full_sentence: Pollution affects much more people living in today's society than it did those in previous years.

questions: I went all the way to see my doctor, _____ find him absent.
full_sentence: I went all the way to see my doctor, only to find him absent.

questions: It is very stupid _____ you to do such a thing.
full_sentence: It is very stupid of you to do such a thing.

questions: John admitted that it's always difficult for him _____ on time.

questions: There is no prepayment required and there is never a _____ of any kind unless you are completely satisfied.

questions: A former Bank of England economist, Record has a(n) _____ reputation as an astute, non-partisan fiscal expert.

questions: The site, due to open next year, will _____ villas, a hotel, golf, game-fishing and diving facilities.

questions: _____ of our cards are printed on our premises and are sold directly to you at the manufacturer's price.

questions: As a child, a friend of mine _____ how different his parents were from married people in stories.

questions: Each and _____ one of us would like to express our great appreciation for your help.

questions: In order to prevent diseases _____ on a worldwide scale, nations must work together.

questions: The formation of snow must occur slowly, in calm air, and at a temperature near the _____ point.

questions: Returning to the United States in 1935, Oppenheimer spent four years _____ on artificially induced radiation.

questions: That angry outburst of father's last night was _____ annoying that it resulted in our guests' packing up and leaving this morning.

questions: _____ they were unaware of his interest in the building, they did not understand why he felt so bad about its being condemned.

questions: The dictionary functions primarily as a tool for _____ the meaning of words.

questions: Passengers traveling in Business or First Class are welcome _____ the Gold Carpet Lounge.

questions: If food is used as a reward or punishment, a child may develop habits leading to _____ consumption or an unbalanced diet.

questions: The pancreas is an organ _____ in the digestion of food, and in the regulation of the sugar level in the bloodstream.

questions: It is estimated that eighty percent of the United States population _____ living in or near cities by the year 2060.

questions: Quartz can easily be recognized _____ it resembles pieces of broken glass.

questions: In recent years, survival game _____ become a popular pastime.

questions: Economists must be able to understand the effect of world events _____ national economies.

questions: In buying a new car, it is extremely important to learn the details of the _____.

questions: The _____ concern of central bank is the maintenance of a sound commercial banking structure.

questions: Cesar Chavez was born near Yuma, Arizona, and _____ his childhood in labor camps.

questions: He used to smoke more than he _____ now.

questions: He has read lots of books, _____ that he is still young.

questions: _____ found, four-leaf clover is considered a lucky sign.

questions: I feel _____ that this should not have been done so carelessly.

questions: Western art in the Middle Ages was _____ an expression of religion.

questions: I respect the department manager, Ms. Jenkins, but I do not like _____ like that.
full_sentence: I respect the department manager, Ms. Jenkins, but I do not like her behaving like that.

questions: It is an _____ custom in the country for men to remove their hats when a woman enters the room.

questions: _____ our increase in rent at the Arrington Forum, we are finding it necessary to raise the price of our season tickets from $228 to $275.
full_sentence: Due to our increase in rent at the Arrington Forum, we are finding it necessary to raise the price of our season tickets from $228 to $275.

questions: Lingua Services Galactic offers a full range of translation services to help you in the development of sales _____ and web sites.

questions: I should be _____ if you would send us your brochure and price list about your services.

questions: James Blond joined the A.N.Y. Company in July 1998. _____ then he has proved to be a most reliable and effective member of the sales team.

questions: Due to the loss in business we regret to inform you that we are _____ all of our hosts and hostesses for the winter and spring.

questions: You are _____ to two weeks' severance pay, which will be paid in full on your next paycheck.

questions: As our contract indicates, we begin charging 5% interest for any _____ balances after 30 days.

questions: _____ is a pleasure to welcome you to the staff of KC Electronics.

questions: Please accept the enclosed certificate, which, when presented, will _____ the bearer to a ten percent discount on the merchandise being purchased at that time.

questions: _____ on the hills above the UC Berkeley campus, Berkeley Lab employs approximately 3,232 scientists, engineers and support staff.

questions: Mr. Austin will be coming to New York on Monday and will be calling on you in the morning if that doesn't _____ with your schedule.

questions: Alcoa Inc. has avoided raising its prices for as long as possible, but it can no longer _____ the inevitable.

questions: _____ the cost for this service will vary depending on the ultimate destination of your package, our prices are highly competitive.

questions: The office space plans in the Towers are unique _____ the building's triangular design, affording maximum use of the column-free floor space.

questions: Stanley Electronics _____ many innovations into its product line since 2014.

questions: _____ receive this discount, you must present your employee identification card at the time of purchase.

questions: The legislature's tariff ruling which was handed down on May 15th, 2006, has made it possible for our company _____ our list price for Egyptian cotton.

questions: If you have any questions during your training period, please do not _____ to contact Mr. Jones.

questions: All of our _____, including pajamas and bedding will be marked down from 50-80% off.

questions: Anyone interested in volunteering to help out with the event is _____ to call Lucy, our events coordinator.

questions: Your January invoice was for 445.00 and we have _____ to receive this payment. Please find a copy of the invoice enclosed.

questions: These programs have been successfully tested in _____ public and private schools throughout the country.

questions: Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory is _____ located next to the National Academy of Sciences (NAS).

questions: Work-related costs _____ transportation and child care, as well as medical and tax expenses drove more people into poverty.

questions: CEO Tim Cook explained to Stephen Colbert why Apple is giving more to charity than it _____ under his predecessor, Steve Jobs.

questions: HP CEO Meg Whitman said the latest job cuts will "enable a more competitive, _____ cost structure" for the new company.

questions: Latin American students are drawn to work places _____ offer opportunities for training and professional development.

questions: We are very proud of our facilities and would love to show them off to you. Please take advantage of our offer by _____ in.

questions: The laboratory is fully _____ to provide the highest quality diagnostic service to physicians.

questions: You may _____ yourself of our famous herbal body wrap, join our exercise classes, take a sauna, sample our swimming pool and jacuzzi, bathe in our mineral baths and work out in our gym.

questions: _____ accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

questions: When it comes _____ document destruction and information security, Shred-it is the industry leader.

questions: About 1 million people _____ ahead of the tsunami wave.

questions: Russia has been slow to recognize the _____ importance of LNG in world energy markets.

questions: _____ between Europe and Asia, the two most energy-consuming markets today, Central Asia offers more than just considerable hydrocarbon assets.

questions: _____ they didn't raise rates now, the majority of Fed committee members believe there will be a rate hike in 2015.

questions: Yandex is Google's biggest competitor in Russia, but its market _____ fell below 60% last year.

questions: _____ the risk involved, progress on TAPI has stalled.

questions: _____ distinguishes companies in innovation-rich countries is a tolerance for failure that is fundamental to the creative process.

questions: Chile's coast is _____ to earthquakes, and the country has a long history of large quakes.

questions: Reed is the _____ of the Silicon Valley set. He thinks big, questions everything and founded a startup called Modest, which was just acquired by PayPal.

questions: After multiple days of losses and incredible _____ along the way, stocks rebounded with force on Wednesday, up almost 4%.

questions: The consumer and non-energy corporate sector are much better _____ because of lower energy prices.

questions: Samsung C&T took over the fashion business after the group's _____ this year.

questions: Credit Suisse recommends that investors _____ against future market swings by investigating structured products.

questions: America's central bank hasn't raised rates in almost a decade and rates have been stuck near zero _____ the depths of the financial crisis in December 2008.

questions: _____ mid-2015, total U.S. household debt sat just under $10.5 trillion.

questions: Oil prices had been inching higher after _____ between July 2014 and January 2015.

questions: Once _____, your application will be reviewed by HCM to determine if you meet the minimum qualifications.
full_sentence: Once submitted, your application will be reviewed by HCM to determine if you meet the minimum qualifications.

questions: Japan's robot revolution is evident at such places as Mitsukoshi department store in central Tokyo, _____ a kimono-clad greeter, "Aiko Chihira" made by Toshiba welcomes visitors.

questions: The U.S. government has _____ the Trans-Pacific Partnership as "a 21st century trade agreement," one that will set high standards for international trade.

questions: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment _____ regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or disability.

questions: KEPRO offers challenging careers, excellent benefits and opportunities for advancement. For consideration, please _____ resume and cover letter with salary requirements.

questions: Schools are back in _____ and the summer vacation season is finally coming to an end.

questions: The biofuels will be chiefly made from palm oil, _____ Indonesia is the world's largest producer and exporter.

questions: The newest versions of iOS have some gimmicky _____ like Parallax, which makes the phone background shift as you move your phone.

questions: By deeply integrating the radios and processors on a chip, Qualcomm _____ the space that the electronics took up inside of cell phones.

questions: At Waste Management, each _____ employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability.
full_sentence: At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability.

questions: We have introduced many innovations into our product line since the last order you _____ with our firm.
full_sentence: We have introduced many innovations into our product line since the last order you placed with our firm.

questions: Ashley HomeStores has catalogs from the major manufacturers of furniture and accessories from which you can make your _____.
full_sentence: Ashley HomeStores has catalogs from the major manufacturers of furniture and accessories from which you can make your selections.

questions: Please contact us, and we will be happy to discuss your needs _____ personally or by telephone, whichever you prefer.
full_sentence: Please contact us, and we will be happy to discuss your needs either personally or by telephone, whichever you prefer.

questions: People use drones for data gathering, crop dusting and a _____ of other causes.

questions: Due to the huge response we received from our summer catalog, we are experiencing a _____ in filling some of the orders.

questions: Some employees not only talked _____ during the meeting but also exhibited the height of rudeness by leaving the room before the completion of meeting.

questions: _____ the increase in raw material costs, Phillips Petroleum Co must unfortunately raise the cost of its merchandise.

questions: Johnson Controls Inc. said it would _____ as many as 3,000 jobs over the next two years as part of its ongoing cost savings program.

questions: The Board agreed to create a new member benefit program that will provide employees _____ discounts or reward points on a variety of products and services.

questions: India's IT industry, _____ innovation plays a critical role, is successful because government is "not there anywhere."

questions: A smaller battery reduces the weight, which reduces the motor size, and in general, _____ a smaller and cheaper device.

questions: The working _____ here is very pleasant with a casual dress code, laid back and friendly atmosphere, but also hard-working and dynamic with the autonomy to drive your job role forward.

questions: Starting December 9, payments made with a sales representative will be charged an additional $2.00 _____ at retail store locations.

questions: Other positives include the fact _____ corporate confidence in Japan has withstood the recent financial market turbulence.

questions: The tiles are splinter and slip resistant, and all Eco Decking tiles come with a 10-year manufacturer's _____.

questions: Fish is packed on ice and sent by overnight _____.

questions: The Department is reviewing its management information systems with a view to _____ more specific information on timber and wood product purchases.

questions: Ambush marketing means that a company misleads audiences by _____ itself as a sponsor of athletes, teams or events when it is not an official sponsor for the event.

questions: By using genetic surgery to _____ "immortalize" cells, the company has banked millions of nerve stem cells in its laboratories.

questions: The government said it would provide tax incentives for long-term holdings for funds, to _____ the stock market and asset management companies.

questions: From $2 trillion, funds _____ management are now estimated at $1.2 trillion and expected to fall below the $1 trillion mark.

questions: He obviously had no technical competence in banking or credit risk management to _____ such a vital governance committee.

questions: _____ of funds could force developing countries into draconian deflation, hurting their economic performance and impeding any global recovery.

questions: As the containers have to be stacked for onward shipment to Germany, closed-top containers must be used _____ health and safety and licensing requirements.

questions: Peter Cowgill, chief executive, said that the results marked the fifth _____ year of "good progress in revenues and profitability".

questions: _____ smuggled tobacco, the current statistics show that one in six cigarettes purchased in this country has been smuggled.

questions: The _____ that appears to be worst hit amongst the aviation industry is the area of cargo.

questions: The _____ line is that tax increases result in reduced government revenues, while tax cuts result in higher revenues.

questions: _____ electronic office equipment such as fax machines and photocopiers is normally leased.

questions: Both the US and Europe have been more _____ to the weakening economic environment, but management acknowledges that there is some uncertainty ahead.

questions: Violet Hill, the first single, was downloaded two million times in one week before going _____ sale.

questions: Retailers can either sit there and do nothing or they can try and _____ sales through discounts and promotions.

questions: Farmers need the futures market to _____ against price swings either way and to set production levels.

questions: The cost of credit would rise _____.

questions: So if equities rise and bonds fall, you sell equities and buy bonds, and _____ when the opposite happens.

questions: Staff are _____ motivated by equity incentives - instead of cash bonuses - and by an outspoken management style.

questions: Car dealers have long _____ potential buyers by offering low-cost finance deals on purchases.

questions: They bought goods that were not top of the range merchandise but inferior shoddy rubbish _____ in China, Taiwan and other such places.

questions: The evidence we have received suggests that the operational _____ and equipment of the Coastguard are not enough at present.

questions: We are working to _____ the development of better focused information for customers.

questions: The shares rallied after the company announced a special _____ of 48 cents.

questions: The company plans to increase its investment on research and marketing _____ one million dollars.

questions: Performance remains an absolute requirement but transparency, _____ and risk management are now at the top of investors' agendas.

questions: The president spoke with both kindness _____ understanding.

questions: The backpack _____ is made of the finest leather is one of the best-selling products in our store.

questions: Every effort is _____ to solve the problems we are experiencing at the moment.

questions: She told me _____ spend more than ten dollars.

questions: Once _____, the three departments will be under the supervision of only one manager.

questions: Ms. Phillips enjoyed _____ with the overseas investors at the annual company stockholders' meeting.

questions: _____ already spent two months in training, Mr. Wallace was eager to begin his new job.

questions: Due to the rapidly deteriorating state of the building, we need to repair it _____ than we thought.

questions: Security guards _____ to report any unusual activities to the control center.

questions: _____ the old computer system, our new network features a broadband connection to the internet.

questions: He denied _____ all those letters for him.

questions: I commend you for your early attention to these details. As always, feel free _____ me with any questions.

questions: _____ a few times a day can help you look young and stay healthy.

D: in the sake of his country

B: if the music is disturbed by people's

questions: Numerous types of financial assistance are available to graduate students _____ GPA is excellent.

questions: We need some topics _____ will make us refreshed.

questions: They are graduate assistants _____ responsibility is to be the research work in the laboratory.

questions: All marble is completed of crystals of the minerals - calcite or dolomite, _____, are perfectly white.

questions: Vegetables _____ lose much of their flavor.

questions: Most crocodiles will eat anything _____ capture and overpower.

questions: _____ is more time.

questions: Most of _____ now Louisiana was once part of an ancient bay.

questions: The behavior of gases is explained by _____ the kinetic theory of heat.

questions: _____ the human body to age is a matter of constant debate.

questions: "To whom shall I give the prize?" Give the prize to _____ you believe studied hard."

questions: He really deserved the award because he performed _____ was expected.

questions: _____ is often the case, the train arrived at an hour late.

questions: Caves and hollow trees are not the only place _____.

questions: _____ sea turtles find their way back to nesting areas is still a mystery.

questions: A frog lays its eggs on water, _____ they float from one to several says.

questions: The bodies of living creatures are organized into many different systems, each of which has _____ function.

questions: The grape is the _____, juicy fruit of a woody vine.

questions: "Is this camera cheap?" "It is not _____ what we paid."

questions: Never eat wild mushrooms, even though they look _____. They may be poisonous.

questions: _____ sex and violence on television can be very damaging to children who watch the program.

questions: We have not had _____ news from the disaster site since the earthquake.

questions: Because the family is poor, the children have _____ clothes.

questions: _____ attempts were made to locate the lost goods.

questions: My mother is so _____ that she believes everything she is told.

questions: Within a year, the company attained _____ independence.

questions: _____ volcano exists in North America at present time.

questions: Dr. Smith's preliminary _____ of the treatment suggests that it is unlikely to be cost effective enough to proceed with the research.

questions: _____ had already been there when John arrived.
full_sentence: All of them had already been there when John arrived.

questions: "What's wrong? You seem restless." I was compelled to pay _____ price for it."

questions: "I had to pay ten dollars for this book." It's probably _____."

questions: It is thought that _____ two fingerprints are identical.

questions: It is easy _____ get on with him.

questions: Is it necessary _____ the book immediately?

questions: _____, Solomon smoked with moody composure.

questions: _____ incense is made in powder form or in sticks.

questions: _____ thirteen Alex Bradford decided to devote his life to gospel music.

questions: _____ rug weavers, tapestry weavers face the back of the fabric as they work.

questions: _____ common potato scab, most scab diseases are caused by various fungi.

questions: _____ or people on fixed incomes, a rise in living costs determines the standard of living they can achieve or maintain.

questions: "Is it time for the game to begin yet?" No, not _____."

questions: His secretary has _____ appointment schedule for him today.

questions: We'll get _____ by train if we leave tonight.

questions: "I read that the stock market is rising." In fact, it is moving faster than _____."

questions: How _____ does the bus stop at Wall?

questions: Wild horses can start more quickly _____ breeds can.

questions: The lower the kindling temperature, _____ a substance catches fire.

questions: All steam engines work for the same reason; steam occupies more than 1,700 times _____ the water from which it comes.
A: of the space of much of
full_sentence: All steam engines work for the same reason; steam occupies more than 1,700 times as much space as the water from which it comes.

questions: _____ possible, definitions which involve the use of obscure language have been avoided.

questions: "Can he buy the car?" "He is as poor as _____ be."

questions: A square meter is _____ a square yard.

questions: I've had _____ time to decide.

questions: You have only one brother, but I have _____ nine brothers and sisters.

questions: We were in a small rowing boat and were terrified that the steamer hadn't seen us as it was bearing _____ on us.

questions: As we have all worked very hard this year, I'm hoping that our efforts will bear _____.

questions: There is really nothing much you can do to stop it and I'm afraid you'll just have to _____ and bear it.

questions: She has been proved right in everything she did as the report quite clearly bears _____.

questions: _____, I couldn't agree with you more.

questions: Candidate: I think the main reason is because I like working in _____.
full_sentence: Candidate: I think the main reason is because I like working in the open air.

questions: Interviewer: You mean you like the idea of an office with _____.

questions: Candidate: I'm sorry I don't understand what you're _____.

questions: Interviewer: So you're not after the job of guardian, _____.

questions: Candidate: No, sorry as I said I like working outside, I want to be a gardener, if you don't _____.
full_sentence: Candidate: No, sorry as I said I like working outside, I want to be a gardener, if you don't if you don't mind.

questions: The train now _____ at the platform 6 is the 10.45 for London.

questions: This is a general notice for all passengers: the restaurant in the main _____ is now open.

questions: We regret to announce that the 10.45 for London is now out of service because the driver is having a nervous _____.

questions: Will the driver of the blue Ford Fiesta XYZ 343 please _____ their car.

questions: We ask the _____ of this vehicle to go back to their car as soon as possible and park their car in another space.

questions: This is a customer _____. We have a special offer at the moment on bananas.

questions: Further to our _____ for the Ford Fiesta to be reparked, this matter is now very urgent. Our lorry cannot get out.
full_sentence: Further to our request for the Ford Fiesta to be reparked, this matter is now very urgent. Our lorry cannot get out.

questions: We have to inform our customers that the store will be closing in half an hour's _____.

questions: There are now only ten minutes remaining for you to make your _____ and go to the checkout.

questions: A final _____ for the driver of the Ford Fiesta: there is no need now to repark as our delivery lorry has done that for you!
full_sentence: A final message for the driver of the Ford Fiesta: there is no need now to repark as our delivery lorry has done that for you!

questions: Ladies and gentlemen, I want to thank you for your _____ of our performance.

questions: We have done this play many times in different towns but your _____ has been the greatest so far.
full_sentence: We have done this play many times in different towns but your applause has been the greatest so far.

questions: We will always remember the way you stood up and _____ at some of the speeches in the play.
full_sentence: We will always remember the way you stood up and clapped at some of the speeches in the play.

questions: Our leading actor is unable to come on the stage at the moment because he is _____ with emotion.
full_sentence: Our leading actor is unable to come on the stage at the moment because he is overcome with emotion.

questions: Don't worry I'm sure it's only _____ and that he'll soon recover before the next performance.
full_sentence: Don't worry I'm sure it's only temporary and that he'll soon recover before the next performance.

questions: That is the reason why I am standing here and making this short _____.
full_sentence: That is the reason why I am standing here and making this short speech.

questions: The leading lady is also absent from our stage and you can probably hear her _____ her heart out as I speak.
full_sentence: The leading lady is also absent from our stage and you can probably hear her sobbing her heart out as I speak.

questions: I think that the main _____ for all this emotion is probably the way you have reacted to the play.
full_sentence: I think that the main reason for all this emotion is probably the way you have reacted to the play.

questions: You see throughout our _____ season we have never received so much laughter as we have from you.
full_sentence: You see throughout our current season we have never received so much laughter as we have from you.

questions: The reason for this is possibly that you thought it was a _____ but in fact it is a tragedy.
full_sentence: The reason for this is possibly that you thought it was a comedy but in fact it is a tragedy.

full_sentence: Welcome to Radio News and now over to our reporter who's covering the procession this morning.

questions: Hi listeners, I should explain that I have a _____ eye view of this magnificent sight as the parade passes underneath me.
full_sentence: Hi listeners, I should explain that I have a bird's eye view of this magnificent sight as the parade passes underneath me.

questions: To tell you the truth I shouldn't be _____ up here on top of this large statue of Field Marshal Smith.
full_sentence: To tell you the truth I shouldn't be perched up here on top of this large statue of Field Marshal Smith.

questions: There is a long line of soldiers on horseback marching to the sound of a _____ band.
full_sentence: There is a long line of soldiers on horseback marching to the sound of a brass band.

questions: It really is quite uncomfortable up here and there's a policeman _____ at me, which I don't like.
full_sentence: It really is quite uncomfortable up here and there's a policeman staring at me, which I don't like.

questions: After the soldiers I can see a group of circus _____ who are jumping and dancing as they go.
full_sentence: After the soldiers I can see a group of circus performers who are jumping and dancing as they go.

questions: Next I can see some pensioners slowly moving along the road and some can't walk and are in _____.
full_sentence: Next I can see some pensioners slowly moving along the road and some can't walk and are in wheelchairs.

questions: That policeman is getting out his _____ and walking near the statue I'm sitting on.
full_sentence: That policeman is getting out his notebook and walking near the statue I'm sitting on.

questions: It has started to rain and I shall get _____ to the skin if I stay much longer up here.
full_sentence: It has started to rain and I shall get soaked to the skin if I stay much longer up here.

questions: Oh dear, listeners, I shall have to return you to the studio because the policeman says he is going to _____ me.
full_sentence: Oh dear, listeners, I shall have to return you to the studio because the policeman says he is going to arrest me.

questions: This is most embarrassing. I can't pay the bill for my meal. I'm afraid I've _____ my wallet at home.
full_sentence: This is most embarrassing. I can't pay the bill for my meal. I'm afraid I've left my wallet at home.

questions: I would be most obliged if you _____ me to pay later.

questions: The other thing I could do is leaving my watch as _____.

questions: I can see by the expression on your face you don't really like the _____.

questions: I could phone someone to _____ me the money.
full_sentence: I could phone someone to bring me the money me the money.

questions: I see. So what you are saying is I'm _____ your trade.
full_sentence: I see. So what you are saying is I'm holding up your trade.

questions: Well, I did say I was sorry and I think _____ you're being very.
full_sentence: Well, I did say I was sorry and I think you're being very unreasonable you're being very.

questions: You say you have no choice but to _____ the manager.
full_sentence: You say you have no choice but to call the manager the manager.

questions: That sounds a good idea. I'm sure he'll _____.
full_sentence: That sounds a good idea. I'm sure he'll sympathise.

questions: All right, all right Mr. manager. Just as you say, _____ I'll wash the dishes in the kitchen.
full_sentence: All right, all right Mr. manager. Just as you say, of course I'll wash the dishes in the kitchen.

questions: In order to check all the telephone calls made during the month I want the account to be _____.
full_sentence: In order to check all the telephone calls made during the month I want the account to be itemized.

questions: All the representatives are allowed to spend money for entertaining with their _____ account.

questions: To spread the cost of spending on articles you buy many big departments let you open a _____.
full_sentence: To spread the cost of spending on articles you buy many big departments let you open a credit.

questions: Once you are earning money and you want to keep it safe, you can always _____ an account with a bank.
full_sentence: Once you are earning money and you want to keep it safe, you can always open an account with a bank.

questions: At the end of thirty days the company will ask you to _____ the account.
full_sentence: At the end of thirty days the company will ask you to settle the account.

questions: The finance director is responsible for _____ the accounts for the business.
