questions: At the end of the financial year it is the responsibility of the chief finance officer to _____ the accounts.
full_sentence: At the end of the financial year it is the responsibility of the chief finance officer to publish the accounts.

questions: Before they got married, they decided to open a _____ account.
full_sentence: Before they got married, they decided to open a joint account.

questions: If you have saved some money, it is a good idea to put the money into a _____ account.
full_sentence: If you have saved some money, it is a good idea to put the money into a deposit account.

questions: However hard I try, I find it impossible to account _____ this missing sum of money.
full_sentence: However hard I try, I find it impossible to account for this missing sum of money.

questions: In order to make a sensible _____ among the different vacuum cleaners available, it is important to do some research.
full_sentence: In order to make a sensible comparison among the different vacuum cleaners available, it is important to do some research.

questions: The local department store has to make a sustained effort at this time of the year to _____ customer demand for summer clothing.
full_sentence: The local department store has to make a sustained effort at this time of the year to satisfy customer demand for summer clothing.

questions: A good team leader must be able to _____ his colleagues to face the challenge of a downturn in business.
full_sentence: A good team leader must be able to inspire his colleagues to face the challenge of a downturn in business.

questions: The _____ trend in children's desire to wear designer label clothes should be exploited.
full_sentence: The current trend in children's desire to wear designer label clothes should be exploited.

questions: You have to _____ the public that it is in their own interest to read the instructions on all our medicines.
full_sentence: You have to convince the public that it is in their own interest to read the instructions on all our medicines.

questions: In order to survive in this business you must adopt a _____ stance.
full_sentence: In order to survive in this business you must adopt a competitive stance.

questions: The _____ of alcohol is not allowed in any of the company's premises in order to present a clean image.
full_sentence: The consumption of alcohol is not allowed in any of the company's premises in order to present a clean image.

questions: When you are setting out to _____ new customers in an advertisement, choose the right words.
full_sentence: When you are setting out to attract new customers in an advertisement, choose the right words.

questions: The really effective television commercial is the one that _____ you of its authenticity.
full_sentence: The really effective television commercial is the one that persuades you of its authenticity.

questions: I can strongly recommend this _____ as the best available on the market today.
full_sentence: I can strongly recommend this product as the best available on the market today.

questions: The contract was signed by the three partners who thus agreed to _____ by terms and conditions contained in it.
full_sentence: The contract was signed by the three partners who thus agreed to abide by terms and conditions contained in it.

questions: There was nothing in the contract that _____ who would be responsible in the event that one of the partners became seriously ill.
full_sentence: There was nothing in the contract that specified who would be responsible in the event that one of the partners became seriously ill.

questions: An independent adviser was called in after the collapse of the company to _____ some of the issues that were not clear.
full_sentence: An independent adviser was called in after the collapse of the company to resolve some of the issues that were not clear.

questions: One of the _____ mentioned in the original agreement has decided that she does not want to continue with the profit-sharing scheme.
full_sentence: One of the parties mentioned in the original agreement has decided that she does not want to continue with the profit-sharing scheme.

questions: In view of the serious problems associated with the takeover the newspaper company has decided to _____ its offer of financial help.
full_sentence: In view of the serious problems associated with the takeover the newspaper company has decided to cancel its offer of financial help.

questions: The main problem was that the newly formed organisation was not attracting enough work and so they decided to _____ the services of a public relations expert.
full_sentence: The main problem was that the newly formed organisation was not attracting enough work and so they decided to engage the services of a public relations expert.

questions: That company has been in business for over 100 years and in fact was _____ in 1899.
full_sentence: That company has been in business for over 100 years and in fact was established in 1899.

questions: After the complaint had been received from the customer about poor service, she was given a written _____ that the matter would be put right.
full_sentence: After the complaint had been received from the customer about poor service, she was given a written assurance that the matter would be put right.

questions: They were very careful to make sure in the original agreement that _____ would be made to pay for staff redundancies.
full_sentence: They were very careful to make sure in the original agreement that provision would be made to pay for staff redundancies.

questions: We decided to employ a solicitor who would be able to _____ the extent of our liability in this matter.
full_sentence: We decided to employ a solicitor who would be able to determine the extent of our liability in this matter.

questions: I would be very interested in _____ for that job.
full_sentence: I would be very interested in applying for that job.

questions: Do you want to _____ as a candidate in the local elections?
full_sentence: Do you want to stand as a candidate in the local elections?

questions: They are completely _____ up with all the noise in the centre of town.
full_sentence: They are completely fed up with all the noise in the centre of town.

questions: The reason there are no buses is because the drivers are on _____.
full_sentence: The reason there are no buses is because the drivers are on strike.

questions: The government has changed its policy and had a complete change of _____.
full_sentence: The government has changed its policy and had a complete change of heart.

questions: This supermarket is trying to _____ young shoppers by offering fashionable clothes.
full_sentence: This supermarket is trying to target young shoppers by offering fashionable clothes.

questions: You should have _____ those shares when they were cheap.
full_sentence: You should have bought up those shares when they were cheap.

questions: You must try and hurry up because my patience is _____ out.
full_sentence: You must try and hurry up because my patience is running out.

questions: Have you ever tried your _____ at running a business?
full_sentence: Have you ever tried your hand at running a business?

questions: After all these years she has decided to take early _____.
full_sentence: After all these years she has decided to take early retirement.

questions: Going on a spending _____ with your credit card and no concern about how you pay back the money you borrow, is a growing habit these days.
full_sentence: Going on a spending spree with your credit card and no concern about how you pay back the money you borrow, is a growing habit these days.

questions: There is a popular demand for the system that allows credit companies to offer unlimited credit to young people to be _____.
full_sentence: There is a popular demand for the system that allows credit companies to offer unlimited credit to young people to be overhauled.

questions: It has been _____ by a government agency that the percentage of under 25 year olds owing large sums to companies is on the increase.
full_sentence: It has been disclosed by a government agency that the percentage of under 25 year olds owing large sums to companies is on the increase.

questions: One director of a major credit company has already been forced to _____ because of the bad publicity his company has attracted.
full_sentence: One director of a major credit company has already been forced to step down because of the bad publicity his company has attracted.

questions: One solution that has been suggested to control credit is to _____ the regulations to make it more difficult to get credit in the first place.
full_sentence: One solution that has been suggested to control credit is to step up the regulations to make it more difficult to get credit in the first place.

questions: The main problem is that a debt _____ has developed recently believing that it is cool to owe large sums of money.
full_sentence: The main problem is that a debt culture has developed recently believing that it is cool to owe large sums of money.

questions: Recent reports have _____ that being in debt is not now looked upon as a disgrace but rather as an attractive way of life.
full_sentence: Recent reports have revealed that being in debt is not now looked upon as a disgrace but rather as an attractive way of life.

questions: In reality it's a very long _____ to get from owing to paying off all your debts.
full_sentence: In reality it's a very long haul to get from owing to paying off all your debts.

questions: There are frequently _____ in the family home between parents and children about whether you should enter into credit agreements.
full_sentence: There are frequently clashes in the family home between parents and children about whether you should enter into credit agreements.

questions: What concerns people most are the mounting _____ among governments that it will take at least a generation for us to be rid of excessive debt.
full_sentence: What concerns people most are the mounting fears among governments that it will take at least a generation for us to be rid of excessive debt.

questions: Without the right software I'm afraid you can't _____ that particular program.
full_sentence: Without the right software I'm afraid you can't access that particular program.

questions: The aim of the office manager is to _____ enough room on the building plans so that each employee can have space for a personal computer.
full_sentence: The aim of the office manager is to allocate enough room on the building plans so that each employee can have space for a personal computer.

questions: Remember that before you leave your workstation, always _____ your computer.
full_sentence: Remember that before you leave your workstation, always shut down your computer.

questions: It's quite easy if you want to find folders and files on the computer, all you do is click here and it immediately starts _____.
full_sentence: It's quite easy if you want to find folders and files on the computer, all you do is click here and it immediately starts searching.

questions: I have tried and tried again and again and no matter what I do it still shows "error" - I just can't _____ what's wrong.
full_sentence: I have tried and tried again and again and no matter what I do it still shows "error" - I just can't figure out what's wrong.

questions: I spent hours writing that report and checking all the information was correct and then without thinking I pressed the _____ button.
full_sentence: I spent hours writing that report and checking all the information was correct and then without thinking I pressed the 'delete' button.

questions: It's a really clever piece of software because it enables you to _____ on your screen all the information in columns.
full_sentence: It's a really clever piece of software because it enables you to display on your screen all the information in columns.

questions: Unfortunately this program is not _____ with the operating system on my computer.
full_sentence: Unfortunately this program is not compatible with the operating system on my computer.

questions: When you see that particular symbol on the screen, you have to take that as a _____ that something is wrong.
full_sentence: When you see that particular symbol on the screen, you have to take that as a warning that something is wrong.

questions: With this program you can always check your spelling and grammar and if you don't want to accept what it shows, you simply press _____.
full_sentence: With this program you can always check your spelling and grammar and if you don't want to accept what it shows, you simply press 'ignore'.

questions: Concern was expressed by the office manager that the company would buy an _____ financial package.
full_sentence: Concern was expressed by the office manager that the company would buy an affordable financial package.

questions: The main _____ of stationery for the office suddenly announced there would be an overall increase in their prices.
full_sentence: The main provider of stationery for the office suddenly announced there would be an overall increase in their prices.

questions: The chief administrative officer disliked lack of attention to detail and insisted that such mistakes should never _____.
full_sentence: The chief administrative officer disliked lack of attention to detail and insisted that such mistakes should never recur.

questions: Once again the company has had to make a _____ in the number of office staff to try and recoup their losses.
full_sentence: Once again the company has had to make a reduction in the number of office staff to try and recoup their losses.

questions: The _____ of zip discs in the office is running dangerously low.
full_sentence: The stock of zip discs in the office is running dangerously low.

questions: If the managers want to stay employed, they will have to learn how to stay on _____ of their jobs.
full_sentence: If the managers want to stay employed, they will have to learn how to stay on top of their jobs.

questions: It's not worth paying for an annual service when you can simply call the supplier on an as _____ basis.
full_sentence: It's not worth paying for an annual service when you can simply call the supplier on an as needed basis.

questions: The new office manager will be in _____ of all the IT requirements that the company uses.
full_sentence: The new office manager will be in charge of all the IT requirements that the company uses.

questions: Currently there is a shortage of clerical staff but it is hoped that by the end of the year they will be up to full _____.
full_sentence: Currently there is a shortage of clerical staff but it is hoped that by the end of the year they will be up to full capacity.

questions: Staff are always encouraged to work by themselves and whenever they meet a problem, they should use their own _____.
full_sentence: Staff are always encouraged to work by themselves and whenever they meet a problem, they should use their own initiative.

questions: On her retirement she was given a substantial cheque in _____ of all the work she had done over the last 20 years.
full_sentence: On her retirement she was given a substantial cheque in appreciation of all the work she had done over the last 20 years.

questions: Having attended the office procedures course all employees were expected to _____ what they had learned and introduce it into their daily routine.
full_sentence: Having attended the office procedures course all employees were expected to reinforce what they had learned and introduce it into their daily routine.

questions: Visiting clients had commented on the casual dress _____ of most of the clerical staff.
full_sentence: Visiting clients had commented on the casual dress code of most of the clerical staff.

questions: The _____ of staff doing physical exercises before the start of the day is well established in Japanese companies.
full_sentence: The practice of staff doing physical exercises before the start of the day is well established in Japanese companies.

questions: There is a lengthy procedure used in this office for staff who have produced shoddy work and it begins with a _____ warning.
full_sentence: There is a lengthy procedure used in this office for staff who have produced shoddy work and it begins with a verbal warning.

questions: There was no fixed agenda for that particular day as it was to be regarded simply as a _____ meeting.
full_sentence: There was no fixed agenda for that particular day as it was to be regarded simply as a casual meeting.

questions: At the interview all the candidates were shown round the building but could only really catch a _____ of the sort of work being carried out.
full_sentence: At the interview all the candidates were shown round the building but could only really catch a glimpse of the sort of work being carried out.

questions: They really need to keep a check on the stationery supplies as they've run _____ A4 paper once again.
full_sentence: They really need to keep a check on the stationery supplies as they've run out of A4 paper once again.

questions: Managers prefer to select people who have been _____ to many different types of office environments.
full_sentence: Managers prefer to select people who have been exposed to many different types of office environments.

questions: A troubleshooter was brought into the office from another firm to get rid of some very _____ procedures.
full_sentence: A troubleshooter was brought into the office from another firm to get rid of some very outdated procedures.

questions: We got there early so that we could get the best _____ in the sale before anyone else.
full_sentence: We got there early so that we could get the best bargains in the sale before anyone else.

questions: If you _____ with me, I'll go and see whether we have that in your size.
full_sentence: If you bear with me, I'll go and see whether we have that in your size.

questions: The trouble with these huge superstores is that they don't have enough _____ to deal with customers at busy times.
full_sentence: The trouble with these huge superstores is that they don't have enough checkouts to deal with customers at busy times.

questions: It started off as a small street corner shop over 30 years ago but it has now _____ into a massive department store.
full_sentence: It started off as a small street corner shop over 30 years ago but it has now expanded into a massive department store.

questions: Take a good look at the receipt when you leave so that you can see that all the _____ have been listed.
full_sentence: Take a good look at the receipt when you leave so that you can see that all the items have been listed.

questions: Whenever I go to the old part of a city, I like to _____ all the shops selling antiques.
full_sentence: Whenever I go to the old part of a city, I like to explore all the shops selling antiques.

questions: Are you aware of the latest _____ in children's clothing?
full_sentence: Are you aware of the latest trend in children's clothing?

questions: They're quite _____ in their policy of not giving refunds without a receipt in this store.
full_sentence: They're quite strict in their policy of not giving refunds without a receipt in this store.

questions: They have a _____ restriction in the shop with regard to the number of items of clothing that you can try on at one time.
full_sentence: They have a mandatory restriction in the shop with regard to the number of items of clothing that you can try on at one time.

questions: The extent of the _____ available in this one store is more than you can possibly imagine.
full_sentence: The extent of the merchandise available in this one store is more than you can possibly imagine.

questions: I was pleased to receive your response to my proposal but there are one or two points that need _____.
full_sentence: I was pleased to receive your response to my proposal but there are one or two points that need clarification.

questions: A report has just been _____ that gives details of the causes of this trend towards informality in the business sector.
full_sentence: A report has just been published that gives details of the causes of this trend towards informality in the business sector.

questions: According to the _____ in the report it is clear that employees under the age of 35 prefer to dress casually at work.
full_sentence: According to the findings in the report it is clear that employees under the age of 35 prefer to dress casually at work.

questions: Thirty years ago this kind of informality would not have been _____.
full_sentence: Thirty years ago this kind of informality would not have been tolerated.

questions: All employees are kindly requested to _____ from smoking in the presence of customers.
full_sentence: All employees are kindly requested to refrain from smoking in the presence of customers.

questions: The meeting went on for three hours and as a result there was no time left to discuss all the topics on the _____.
full_sentence: The meeting went on for three hours and as a result there was no time left to discuss all the topics on the agenda.

questions: There's really no point in hoping to add important topics right at the end of the meeting under the heading of any other _____.
full_sentence: There's really no point in hoping to add important topics right at the end of the meeting under the heading of any other business.

questions: The chairman was obliged to bring the meeting to a _____ because a fire broke out in the adjoining room.
full_sentence: The chairman was obliged to bring the meeting to a halt because a fire broke out in the adjoining room.

questions: It is absolutely essential that the clerk takes care to _____ any decisions that have been reached during the meeting.
full_sentence: It is absolutely essential that the clerk takes care to minute any decisions that have been reached during the meeting.

questions: As so few members had turned up at the meeting, it was decided to _____ it until further notice.
full_sentence: As so few members had turned up at the meeting, it was decided to postpone it until further notice.

questions: I heard of a new company today with which we should co-operate and _____ business with.
full_sentence: I heard of a new company today with which we should co-operate and do business with.

questions: Shortly after he was dismissed from the firm he decided to _____ himself up in his own business.
full_sentence: Shortly after he was dismissed from the firm he decided to set himself up in his own business.

questions: They went _____ business shortly after their children had left home and got married.
full_sentence: They went into business shortly after their children had left home and got married.

questions: As soon as they heard what had happened, they _____ it their business to find out the truth.
full_sentence: As soon as they heard what had happened, they made it their business to find out the truth.

questions: I would ask you kindly not to interfere with what I'm doing as in all honesty it's _____ of your business.
full_sentence: I would ask you kindly not to interfere with what I'm doing as in all honesty it's none of your business.

questions: Despite all the alterations that are taking place in the department store, the management wanted to explain it was business as _____.
full_sentence: Despite all the alterations that are taking place in the department store, the management wanted to explain it was business as usual.

questions: She knew that there was some kind of _____ business going on because strange things were happening.
full_sentence: She knew that there was some kind of funny business going on because strange things were happening.

questions: We really can't delay any more with our plans and must _____ down to business as soon as possible.
full_sentence: We really can't delay any more with our plans and must get down to business as soon as possible.

questions: When the bomb went off, most of the injured were just ordinary people going _____ their business.
full_sentence: When the bomb went off, most of the injured were just ordinary people going about their business.

questions: Although they had high hopes that they would be successful, they _____ out of business within six months.
full_sentence: Although they had high hopes that they would be successful, they went out of business within six months.

questions: I've warned you before that you shouldn't get involved in this matter and you have _____ business discussing it.
full_sentence: I've warned you before that you shouldn't get involved in this matter and you have no business discussing it.

questions: That's really not my concern at all and I'm certainly not _____ the business of telling others what to do.
full_sentence: That's really not my concern at all and I'm certainly not in the business of telling others what to do.

questions: She was very enthusiastic about her new job and was making rapid progress _____ nobody's business.
full_sentence: She was very enthusiastic about her new job and was making rapid progress like nobody's business.

questions: I really wouldn't joke about it because these people are deadly serious and _____ business.
full_sentence: I really wouldn't joke about it because these people are deadly serious and mean business.

questions: He didn't hesitate to tell me that I wasn't wanted and just told me to _____ my own business.
full_sentence: He didn't hesitate to tell me that I wasn't wanted and just told me to mind my own business.

questions: I'm afraid it won't be possible to talk to the boss today because he's away _____ business till Tuesday.
full_sentence: I'm afraid it won't be possible to talk to the boss today because he's away on business till Tuesday.

questions: He was very keen that we kept in touch and for that reason he handed me his business _____.
full_sentence: He was very keen that we kept in touch and for that reason he handed me his business card.

questions: This is the really important part of the machine and that's why we call it the business _____.
full_sentence: This is the really important part of the machine and that's why we call it the business end.

questions: The whole site has nothing but offices and administration centres and that's why we call it a business _____.
full_sentence: The whole site has nothing but offices and administration centres and that's why we call it a business park.

questions: All the famous film stars, actors, directors and writers were at the festival representing the world of _____ business.
full_sentence: All the famous film stars, actors, directors and writers were at the festival representing the world of show business.

questions: The company had its own code of _____ in these matters.
full_sentence: The company had its own code of practice in these matters.

questions: This is a _____ example of what not to do.
full_sentence: This is a prime example of what not to do.

questions: Plans have already been drawn _____ to deal with such situations.
full_sentence: Plans have already been drawn up to deal with such situations.

questions: Thousands of _____ are already signing up for this new telephone service.
full_sentence: Thousands of subscribers are already signing up for this new telephone service.

questions: Job losses are mainly in the _____ sectors of the industry.
full_sentence: Job losses are mainly in the blue-collar sectors of the industry.

questions: The circular will contain _____ financial information to help investors.
full_sentence: The circular will contain key financial information to help investors.

questions: The report is _____ to show better than expected results.
full_sentence: The report is likely to show better than expected results.

questions: So many of these animals have been shot over the years that they are now classed as _____ species.
full_sentence: So many of these animals have been shot over the years that they are now classed as endangered species.

questions: Some people are _____ to learn a foreign language.
full_sentence: Some people are reluctant to learn a foreign language.

questions: It was a big _____ for her to give up her acting career to look after her family.
full_sentence: It was a big sacrifice for her to give up her acting career to look after her family.

questions: My computer is not capable of saving material on a separate _____ because it has no floppy drive.
full_sentence: My computer is not capable of saving material on a separate disc because it has no floppy drive.

questions: I understand that I can make it possible for both my computers to share the same programs by means of _____.
full_sentence: I understand that I can make it possible for both my computers to share the same programs by means of networking.

questions: I had only had my computer for three weeks when I had to have the hard drive _____.
full_sentence: I had only had my computer for three weeks when I had to have the hard drive replaced.

questions: Laptop computers are becoming more and more _____ in the business world.
full_sentence: Laptop computers are becoming more and more popular in the business world.

questions: You have to have a really _____ mind in order to get your head round some of today's computing technology.
full_sentence: You have to have a really sharp mind in order to get your head round some of today's computing technology.

questions: The great advantage of having an external zip drive is that you can use it as an extra means of _____.
full_sentence: The great advantage of having an external zip drive is that you can use it as an extra means of storage.

questions: They tried very hard to install the new components on the computer but the language in the manual was too _____ for them to understand.
full_sentence: They tried very hard to install the new components on the computer but the language in the manual was too technical for them to understand.

questions: When you look at the modern office today you could compare the changes with those that took place in the industrial _____ in the 19th century.
full_sentence: When you look at the modern office today you could compare the changes with those that took place in the industrial revolution in the 19th century.

questions: In order to _____ the method by which staff pay is calculated the company has bought a new software package.
full_sentence: In order to facilitate the method by which staff pay is calculated the company has bought a new software package.

questions: Obviously a computer can take all the hard work out of _____ a large mass of data.
full_sentence: Obviously a computer can take all the hard work out of processing a large mass of data.

questions: The stock market has hit new _____ this year.
full_sentence: The stock market has hit new lows this year.

questions: The government has decided to hold an _____ into the latest financial scandal.
full_sentence: The government has decided to hold an enquiry into the latest financial scandal.

questions: The animal rights organisation has _____ a new campaign to make people aware of cruelty to animals.
full_sentence: The animal rights organisation has launched a new campaign to make people aware of cruelty to animals.

questions: I was totally _____ of the increased taxes.
full_sentence: I was totally unaware of the increased taxes.

questions: The price of petrol has _____ again.
full_sentence: The price of petrol has risen again.

questions: The ordinary person is again being asked to _____ to pay for dental treatment.
full_sentence: The ordinary person is again being asked to stump up to pay for dental treatment.

questions: This car is intended for the _____ market only.
full_sentence: This car is intended for the export market only.

questions: Credit card holders struggle very hard to _____ the amount they owe.
full_sentence: Credit card holders struggle very hard to reduce the amount they owe.

questions: This charity was set up to _____ money for the poor.
full_sentence: This charity was set up to collect money for the poor.

questions: Everything _____ all right in the end.
full_sentence: Everything turned out all right in the end.

questions: We're paying for a stand at the new industrial exhibition with a view to _____ interest among potential employees in our company.
full_sentence: We're paying for a stand at the new industrial exhibition with a view to generating interest among potential employees in our company.

questions: For the first three months of your employment with the firm you will be under the care of a _____.
full_sentence: For the first three months of your employment with the firm you will be under the care of a mentor.

questions: Although she was very tempted to accept the job she was offered, she had to _____ the offer because the salary would have been insufficient.
full_sentence: Although she was very tempted to accept the job she was offered, she had to reject the offer because the salary would have been insufficient.

questions: A university education is of course important but it is essential that all employees undergo a period of intensive _____.
full_sentence: A university education is of course important but it is essential that all employees undergo a period of intensive training.

questions: A newsletter is sent out every ten days to all the staff so that they receive a regular _____ on recent appointments.
full_sentence: A newsletter is sent out every ten days to all the staff so that they receive a regular update on recent appointments.

questions: Part of the ongoing training is to ensure that a regular time and place are _____ for department heads to meet their staff.
full_sentence: Part of the ongoing training is to ensure that a regular time and place are set up for department heads to meet their staff.

questions: The head of department acknowledged that the _____ of the section was largely due to high quality support staff.
full_sentence: The head of department acknowledged that the success of the section was largely due to high quality support staff.

questions: The pace of change in that industry is so fast that staff find it hard to _____ the latest developments.
full_sentence: The pace of change in that industry is so fast that staff find it hard to keep up with the latest developments.

questions: It is the policy of the company to _____ all interviews for new recruits with a member of the trade union present.
full_sentence: It is the policy of the company to conduct all interviews for new recruits with a member of the trade union present.

questions: In view of the excessive workload you have at the moment I won't expect you to keep _____ during the next few days.
full_sentence: In view of the excessive workload you have at the moment I won't expect you to keep on track during the next few days.

questions: It's a gamble at the moment whether the company will make profit in its second year but that nevertheless is the _____ aim.
full_sentence: It's a gamble at the moment whether the company will make profit in its second year but that nevertheless is the desired aim.

questions: Each year the Chancellor of the Exchequer stands up in the House of Commons and gives a _____ of what is seen as the economic outlook for the country.
full_sentence: Each year the Chancellor of the Exchequer stands up in the House of Commons and gives a forecast of what is seen as the economic outlook for the country.

questions: I think that your financial optimism is not really justified and you should adopt a more _____ attitude.
full_sentence: I think that your financial optimism is not really justified and you should adopt a more realistic attitude.

questions: If you want to increase sales of a particular product, you must be sure that you are _____ the right customers.
full_sentence: If you want to increase sales of a particular product, you must be sure that you are targeting the right customers.

questions: The idea caught on very quickly and people were queuing up to buy the goods so that year the company's investment _____ substantial profits.
full_sentence: The idea caught on very quickly and people were queuing up to buy the goods so that year the company's investment yielded substantial profits.

questions: _____ it has not been a bad year as our costs are well down on last year's.
full_sentence: Overall it has not been a bad year as our costs are well down on last year's.

questions: Managers complained bitterly at the Annual General Meeting that _____ of production had dropped to an all time low.
full_sentence: Managers complained bitterly at the Annual General Meeting that levels of production had dropped to an all time low.

questions: You have to accept that this kind of expenditure is quite _____ in an enterprise of this kind.
full_sentence: You have to accept that this kind of expenditure is quite typical in an enterprise of this kind.

questions: The figures that have just been published by the company's accountants will give management some kind of _____ on how sales are going.
full_sentence: The figures that have just been published by the company's accountants will give management some kind of perspective on how sales are going.

questions: Whenever a member of staff makes a claim for travel expenses, they have to provide a _____ account of their journeys.
full_sentence: Whenever a member of staff makes a claim for travel expenses, they have to provide a detailed account of their journeys.

questions: The one big fear of all world economies is that of _____.
full_sentence: The one big fear of all world economies is that of recession.

questions: You are never too young to start _____ some money in a savings account.
full_sentence: You are never too young to start investing some money in a savings account.

questions: If ever you find you have an unexpected expense, you can always _____ some money from your savings.
full_sentence: If ever you find you have an unexpected expense, you can always withdraw some money from your savings.

questions: At certain times of the year your shares will _____ a good profit but you must also be prepared for them to go down in value.
full_sentence: At certain times of the year your shares will yield a good profit but you must also be prepared for them to go down in value.

questions: You can _____ the cost of insuring your car if you keep it in a garage.
full_sentence: You can cut the cost of insuring your car if you keep it in a garage.

questions: We got a very good _____ when we bought that three piece suite for half its usual price.
full_sentence: We got a very good deal when we bought that three piece suite for half its usual price.

questions: Now that the summer has started, big department stores are hoping that sales of holiday items will _____.
full_sentence: Now that the summer has started, big department stores are hoping that sales of holiday items will take off.

questions: The two companies have decided to _____ because they believe that their combined resources will produce greater profits.
full_sentence: The two companies have decided to merge because they believe that their combined resources will produce greater profits.

questions: When someone dies and their _____ reach a certain figure, their family has to pay an additional tax.
full_sentence: When someone dies and their assets reach a certain figure, their family has to pay an additional tax.

questions: The loan you have taken out is for a _____ term, which in your case is 5 years.
full_sentence: The loan you have taken out is for a fixed term, which in your case is 5 years.

questions: When you go to an auction and you want to buy a particular item, you can simply make a _____ for it.
full_sentence: When you go to an auction and you want to buy a particular item, you can simply make a bid for it.

questions: The larger company did not really want to join with the smaller one because it was more interested in a _____.
full_sentence: The larger company did not really want to join with the smaller one because it was more interested in a takeover.

questions: _____ on the stockmarket just before Christmas is usually very slow.
full_sentence: Trading on the stockmarket just before Christmas is usually very slow.

questions: This sport centre has largely been _____ by money that has come from the national lottery.
full_sentence: This sport centre has largely been funded by money that has come from the national lottery.

questions: The reason for the _____ in the economy is because there is a great deal of uncertainty at the moment.

questions: The _____ in the market was seen as a positive sign that the recession was over.
full_sentence: The upturn in the market was seen as a positive sign that the recession was over.

questions: The _____ books for manufacturers of small cars are now full following the rise in petrol.

questions: The future of his job was at _____ when he made the decision to invest in new machinery.

questions: After their house had been _____, they decided to sell it and buy a bigger one.
full_sentence: After their house had been valued, they decided to sell it and buy a bigger one.

questions: Fifty people were made _____ when the company suffered a severe financial shock.

questions: If you cannot get a job and remain _____ for a long period, you can claim some money from the state.
full_sentence: If you cannot get a job and remain unemployed for a long period, you can claim some money from the state.

questions: The great thing about this guarantee is that there is never any doubt and there is no _____ about getting your money back.
full_sentence: The great thing about this guarantee is that there is never any doubt and there is no quibble about getting your money back.

questions: There is a substantial _____ between the money you have available and the amount you need to spend.

questions: When you retire, you should get a pension and a _____ sum from your employers.
full_sentence: When you retire, you should get a pension and a lump sum from your employers.

questions: _____ are people who put money into a business in the hope of making a profit.
full_sentence: Investors are people who put money into a business in the hope of making a profit.

questions: When you take out a large loan over many years, you don't start paying off the _____ for some time.
full_sentence: When you take out a large loan over many years, you don't start paying off the capital for some time.

questions: We will make no _____ for the catalogue, which you can take with our compliments.
full_sentence: We will make no charge for the catalogue, which you can take with our compliments.

questions: It may seem a long way into the future but in the end you will get some _____ from your investment.
full_sentence: It may seem a long way into the future but in the end you will get some benefit from your investment.

questions: There is still an outstanding _____ on that account, which must be paid in 30 days.
full_sentence: There is still an outstanding balance on that account, which must be paid in 30 days.

questions: Interest _____ are at their lowest level since the 1950's.
full_sentence: Interest rates are at their lowest level since the 1950's.

questions: If you go to an unauthorized garage to have your car serviced, the _____ is that your warranty will be invalid.
full_sentence: If you go to an unauthorized garage to have your car serviced, the consequence is that your warranty will be invalid.

questions: The guarantee, as I understood it, _____ that everything was covered.
full_sentence: The guarantee, as I understood it, implied that everything was covered.

questions: I regret to inform you that as your guarantee _____ last week, we can't help you.
full_sentence: I regret to inform you that as your guarantee expired last week, we can't help you.

questions: A warranty is to be looked on as a sort of _____ between the manufacturer and you.

questions: Sometimes people don't bother about guarantees because the _____ of the manufacturer is enough for them.

questions: Certain warranties _____ the purchaser to have the item serviced at regular intervals.

questions: You will find that such warranties are not worth buying because the cover provided is _____ not worth the extra expense.
full_sentence: You will find that such warranties are not worth buying because the cover provided is frequently not worth the extra expense.

questions: This kind of legislation is in existence to _____ the customer from worthless warranties.

questions: You sometimes have to _____ very seriously whether to buy a second hand car which has no guarantee.
full_sentence: You sometimes have to consider very seriously whether to buy a second hand car which has no guarantee.

questions: Sometimes you get a one year warranty, a two year one or even a six month one - they all _____.
full_sentence: Sometimes you get a one year warranty, a two year one or even a six month one - they all vary.

questions: You can be absolutely sure I'm on your _____.
full_sentence: You can be absolutely sure I'm on your side.

questions: You can _____ on me for your support.
full_sentence: You can rely on me for your support.

questions: Our views clearly _____ at this point I'm pleased to say.
full_sentence: Our views clearly coincide at this point I'm pleased to say.

questions: Fortunately the leader and all her members were singing from the same _____ sheet.
full_sentence: Fortunately the leader and all her members were singing from the same hymn sheet.

questions: It's good that we both have the same way of _____ at things.
full_sentence: It's good that we both have the same way of looking at things.

questions: I'm pleased to say that we speak on this matter with one _____.
full_sentence: I'm pleased to say that we speak on this matter with one voice.

questions: I certainly won't _____ any objection when you make your proposal.
full_sentence: I certainly won't raise any objection when you make your proposal.

questions: I'm _____ you all the way as far as that's concerned.
full_sentence: I'm with you all the way as far as that's concerned.

questions: I'm happy to _____ those sentiments and wish you every success.
full_sentence: I'm happy to endorse those sentiments and wish you every success.

questions: When it comes to the vote I'm willing to put my _____ up and support you.

questions: Please _____ me for interrupting you, I didn't realize you were busy with someone else.
full_sentence: Please forgive me for interrupting you, I didn't realize you were busy with someone else.

questions: I'm very _____ that I'm late but there is a train strike on at the moment.

questions: Please send my _____ to the meeting as I shan't be able to attend.
full_sentence: Please send my apologies to the meeting as I shan't be able to attend.

questions: There's really no _____ for my behaviour last night. I can only think that I'd had too much to drink.
full_sentence: There's really no excuse for my behaviour last night. I can only think that I'd had too much to drink.

questions: I know I shouldn't have made those remarks about your work and I hope you now know how deeply I _____ what I said.
full_sentence: I know I shouldn't have made those remarks about your work and I hope you now know how deeply I regret what I said.

questions: I must _____ your pardon, I mistook you for somebody else.
full_sentence: I must beg your pardon, I mistook you for somebody else.

questions: If it helps to put things right, please let me take _____ everything I said earlier.
full_sentence: If it helps to put things right, please let me take back everything I said earlier.

questions: Please accept this small present as my way of making _____ for all the trouble I've caused.
full_sentence: Please accept this small present as my way of making amends for all the trouble I've caused.

questions: All I can do now is simply beg your _____ and hope that in time we can get back to where we used to be.
full_sentence: All I can do now is simply beg your indulgence and hope that in time we can get back to where we used to be.

questions: In their religion as long as they _____, they will be forgiven their sins.
full_sentence: In their religion as long as they repent, they will be forgiven their sins.

questions: Am I going in the right _____ for the post office?

questions: Can you tell me please how I _____ to the cinema from here?
full_sentence: Can you tell me please how I get to the cinema from here?

questions: Could you please _____ me in the direction of the motorway?

questions: I'm making for the M25 motorway - is this road the most _____ route?

questions: Could you tell me please how _____ I am from the town centre?

questions: Can you help please because I've lost my way and _____ to get to the shops before closing time?
full_sentence: Can you help please because I've lost my way and need to get to the shops before closing time?

questions: I'm _____ for the town hall - am I anywhere near?
full_sentence: I'm making for the town hall - am I anywhere near?

questions: I took the wrong _____ at the last road junction, can you tell me how I get back on the motorway?
full_sentence: I took the wrong turning at the last road junction, can you tell me how I get back on the motorway?

questions: _____ to this map I should be near the church. Is it near?
full_sentence: According to this map I should be near the church. Is it near?

questions: Is this _____ for the railway station?
full_sentence: Is this right for the railway station?

questions: I'm really not satisfied with the way you have _____ the situation.
full_sentence: I'm really not satisfied with the way you have handled the situation.

questions: I've really had enough of all your excuses, what I want is some _____.
full_sentence: I've really had enough of all your excuses, what I want is some action.

questions: You've refused to help me now for six months and so I shall now have to take the matter _____.
full_sentence: You've refused to help me now for six months and so I shall now have to take the matter further.

questions: I must _____ you do something immediately as I've been patient long enough.

questions: I now want some kind of compensation for the total _____ of service I've experienced.

questions: I'm obviously not getting anywhere with my complaint please let me talk to someone _____ to you.

questions: I'm very unhappy with the way I've been _____. No one seems at all interested in my case.
full_sentence: I'm very unhappy with the way I've been treated. No one seems at all interested in my case.

questions: I believe I have very good _____ for suing your company for negligence.

questions: If you don't do something today, I shall be _____ to take legal action.
full_sentence: If you don't do something today, I shall be forced to take legal action.

questions: You're the tenth person I've been put through to and I'm on the point of losing my _____.
full_sentence: You're the tenth person I've been put through to and I'm on the point of losing my temper.

questions: Quite honestly I didn't think _____ of the standard of acting in the play.
full_sentence: Quite honestly I didn't think much of the standard of acting in the play.

questions: If you want my _____ opinion, I thought the food tasted revolting.
full_sentence: If you want my honest opinion, I thought the food tasted revolting.

questions: To come straight to the _____ I think the management team needs replacing.
full_sentence: To come straight to the point I think the management team needs replacing.

questions: There are several matters on which I should like to take _____ concerning your report.
full_sentence: There are several matters on which I should like to take issue concerning your report.

questions: There's really no virtue in me _____ around because I might as well tell you it's awful.
full_sentence: There's really no virtue in me pussyfooting around because I might as well tell you it's awful.

questions: I have a long _____ of things I think are wrong, where shall I start?
full_sentence: I have a long list of things I think are wrong, where shall I start?

questions: I'm afraid to tell you that your standard of work has fallen well below what we think is _____.
full_sentence: I'm afraid to tell you that your standard of work has fallen well below what we think is acceptable.

questions: In all honesty if I said that everything was all right, I'd simply be _____.
full_sentence: In all honesty if I said that everything was all right, I'd simply be lying.

questions: If you can't improve your level of work, I'm afraid you'll have to look _____ for another job.
full_sentence: If you can't improve your level of work, I'm afraid you'll have to look elsewhere for another job.

questions: I'm sick and _____ of always having to put right your mistakes.

questions: I'm sorry but I can't _____ your opinion on that.

questions: I very much regret that we must _____ company on that issue.

questions: Let's be honest about it we'll never agree on that because our views are diametrically _____.
full_sentence: Let's be honest about it we'll never agree on that because our views are diametrically opposed.

questions: We'll never agree, that's clear so let's _____ to differ.
full_sentence: We'll never agree, that's clear so let's beg to differ.

questions: You can argue with me till the cows come _____ but I can't accept that.
full_sentence: You can argue with me till the cows come home but I can't accept that.

questions: I really see no point in continuing this argument because we have no _____ ground.

questions: There's absolutely no way I can _____ you on that matter.

questions: Nothing in the world will ever make me change my _____ on that subject.
full_sentence: Nothing in the world will ever make me change my mind on that subject.

questions: I would love to meet you half way but I'm afraid I can't because with me it's a matter of _____.

questions: Let's _____ it, you and I will never see eye to eye on this.

questions: Well _____! This is a very good piece of work.

questions: I must congratulate you on your efforts. _____ it up!

questions: Don't give up whatever you do. I'm sure you'll _____ it in the end.

questions: I'll _____ by you no matter what happens.

questions: I'm sure if you _____, you'll succeed.

questions: You've clearly got _____ and it's obvious that you'll get to the top.

questions: I've watched a lot of young people try to make a success of it, but you're the only one I really _____ in.

questions: I see no _____ why you shouldn't be accepted as an employee.

questions: Never _____ up. That's a good philosophy.

questions: You mustn't ever be _____ off by a few setbacks.

questions: What a wonderful day to see the mountains _____!
full_sentence: What a wonderful day to see the mountains on!

questions: How stupid can I get! I _____ my keys in the door overnight.
full_sentence: How stupid can I get! I left my keys in the door overnight.

questions: For goodness sake stop _____ about the weather! It'll stop raining soon.
full_sentence: For goodness sake stop complaining about the weather! It'll stop raining soon.

questions: What on earth are you talking about? I can't make head or _____ of it.
full_sentence: What on earth are you talking about? I can't make head or tail of it.

questions: How nice of you to come all this _____ just to wish me a happy birthday.

questions: What a disaster! I don't believe anything else could go _____ now.

questions: Wow! You've certainly made a good _____ of decorating this room.

questions: Well blow me down! I just can't believe I've actually _____ my exam.

questions: You could have knocked me down with a feather! You mean to say he's _____ cleaned my car.
full_sentence: You could have knocked me down with a feather! You mean to say he's actually cleaned my car.

questions: I'll go to the foot of my stairs! It must be at _____ 20 years since we last met.

questions: I took out a life insurance _____ with State Ranch Insurance Company last week.

questions: My insurance _____ are only $70 per month.

questions: In the event of my death, the _____ will be my widow.

questions: My insurance does not _____ me if I commit suicide.

questions: The amount of money that my wife will get has already been calculated by State Ranch's _____.
full_sentence: The amount of money that my wife will get has already been calculated by State Ranch's actuary.

questions: If I decide that I no longer need my insurance, I can cash it in for the amount of its _____ value.
full_sentence: If I decide that I no longer need my insurance, I can cash it in for the amount of its return value.

questions: Before I got the insurance, I had to receive a complete physical _____.
full_sentence: Before I got the insurance, I had to receive a complete physical examination.

questions: I am feeling great, because the doctor told me that I have a life _____ of 82 years!

questions: Even if I am late in paying, the insurance remains in effect for a _____ period of 30 days.
full_sentence: Even if I am late in paying, the insurance remains in effect for a grace period of 30 days.

questions: The insurance is pretty expensive though: I am a policeman, so there are a lot of occupational _____.
full_sentence: The insurance is pretty expensive though: I am a policeman, so there are a lot of occupational hazards.

questions: One of the great advantages of using the Internet is that people can _____ more quickly.
full_sentence: One of the great advantages of using the Internet is that people can interact more quickly.

questions: It's no good spending a small fortune on new IT equipment as it's more cost _____ to hire it.

questions: One of the fashionable ways of saying you've been sacked is to say that your company is _____ but you've still lost your job.

questions: The important thing to realise is that your service is not a little island on its own because all the services in this company are _____.
full_sentence: The important thing to realise is that your service is not a little island on its own because all the services in this company are interconnected.

questions: Whereas ten years ago we only dealt with customers in this country nowadays we are truly _____ with branches all over the world.

full_sentence: One of the most successful tools in your organisation is that of good communication because everybody knows what's going on.

questions: Let me just _____ what we have agreed in the agenda so far if nobody minds me going over it all again.

questions: You have to realise that not all your clients can reach you online because they don't have _____ to a computer.
full_sentence: You have to realise that not all your clients can reach you online because they don't have access to a computer.

questions: There are times when you have to force yourself to improve your performance and that's simply called self- _____.
full_sentence: There are times when you have to force yourself to improve your performance and that's simply called self- motivation.

questions: You must think big in this business and not just think short _____ but what you hope to do in ten years' time.
full_sentence: You must think big in this business and not just think short term but what you hope to do in ten years' time.

questions: It's all very well having a dream or an idea but you must know where you're going and what your _____ is.
full_sentence: It's all very well having a dream or an idea but you must know where you're going and what your goal is.

questions: Her job in the company was to sort out the relevant information thereby _____ it so that only appropriate material was sent to her directors.
full_sentence: Her job in the company was to sort out the relevant information thereby filtering it so that only appropriate material was sent to her directors.

questions: She told him to stop wasting time by coming up with tried and tested ideas and in this way simply re-inventing the _____.
full_sentence: She told him to stop wasting time by coming up with tried and tested ideas and in this way simply re-inventing the wheel.

questions: The product had been on the market for some years and was selling well but somehow the image was in need of a face lift or _____.
full_sentence: The product had been on the market for some years and was selling well but somehow the image was in need of a face lift or enhancement.

questions: In the hope of finding fresh ideas he used the internet to help him by using as many search _____ as he could discover.
full_sentence: In the hope of finding fresh ideas he used the internet to help him by using as many search portals as he could discover.

questions: You must increase the sale of this commodity by trying to interest a different age range and by _____ into their society.
full_sentence: You must increase the sale of this commodity by trying to interest a different age range and by tapping into their society.

questions: You'll never make any more money or _____ new income if you keep using that unimaginative marketing logo.
full_sentence: You'll never make any more money or generate new income if you keep using that unimaginative marketing logo.

questions: Now that you've explained the scope and _____ of the market, we are very keen to inject some money into your project.
full_sentence: Now that you've explained the scope and dimension of the market, we are very keen to inject some money into your project.

questions: There is always a risk in any business _____ when your scheme is based on an entirely new concept.
full_sentence: There is always a risk in any business venture when your scheme is based on an entirely new concept.

questions: Get in there first and don't hesitate to act as the boss and take the _____.
full_sentence: Get in there first and don't hesitate to act as the boss and take the lead.

questions: One of the most important qualities which the panel is looking for in a candidate is the _____ to work with others.
full_sentence: One of the most important qualities which the panel is looking for in a candidate is the ability to work with others.

questions: Once the applications have been looked at the usual procedure for the panel is to follow _____ the references of those candidates who have been shortlisted.
full_sentence: Once the applications have been looked at the usual procedure for the panel is to follow up the references of those candidates who have been shortlisted.

questions: They were so impressed with the way she reacted to their questions that they didn't _____ to offer her the job.

questions: As this job was of a very specialist nature an _____ was invited to join the interview panel.
full_sentence: As this job was of a very specialist nature an expert was invited to join the interview panel.

questions: After the interview one of the candidates _____ phoned the office to see whether he had been successful.
full_sentence: After the interview one of the candidates constantly phoned the office to see whether he had been successful.

questions: She was in such a state of extreme nervousness when she was _____ for the interview that she burst into tears.
full_sentence: She was in such a state of extreme nervousness when she was called in for the interview that she burst into tears.

questions: From the point of view of relevant _____ she was the ideal candidate at least on paper.

questions: It is absolutely essential in an interview to give the impression at least that you are full of _____.
full_sentence: It is absolutely essential in an interview to give the impression at least that you are full of confidence.

questions: One of the most popular questions asked of interviewees is to explain their strengths and _____.

questions: Each candidate was asked to _____ a short account of how they saw the future of the company.

questions: There is an additional _____ added to the price of the product if you want to have it delivered to your house.

questions: You should have read the _____ of payment as soon as you received the invoice for the goods.

questions: In order to cut down the expenses of compiling and sending out the invoices, you need to employ an _____ administrator.
full_sentence: In order to cut down the expenses of compiling and sending out the invoices, you need to employ an efficient administrator.

questions: It's always a good idea to get an _____ of what the cost of the work will be before the invoice lands on your doormat.
full_sentence: It's always a good idea to get an estimate of what the cost of the work will be before the invoice lands on your doormat.

questions: I do like to get a _____ reply to my letters especially when they are referring to the amount of money I'm supposed to be paying.
full_sentence: I do like to get a prompt reply to my letters especially when they are referring to the amount of money I'm supposed to be paying.

questions: Just as we were about to leave the restaurant, the waiter came running up to apologize there had been a _____ in the bill.
full_sentence: Just as we were about to leave the restaurant, the waiter came running up to apologize there had been a mistake in the bill.

questions: The company were very quick to point out it was their fault we had been sent the wrong invoice and they _____ it immediately.
full_sentence: The company were very quick to point out it was their fault we had been sent the wrong invoice and they rectified it immediately.

questions: In view of our previous orders over the last year we were offered a 10% _____ on any future dealings.

questions: He appreciated the additional welcome and help he received from the department store staff as he had after all been a longstanding _____.
full_sentence: He appreciated the additional welcome and help he received from the department store staff as he had after all been a longstanding customer.

questions: She got quite angry about the size of the invoice until it was pointed out that it was the government who _____ the value added tax.

questions: Tell us something about your _____ in the engineering industry?

questions: I see from your _____ form that you have had three different jobs in the last 5 years.

questions: What sort of _____ of time would you stay with us if we offered you the job?
full_sentence: What sort of period of time would you stay with us if we offered you the job?

questions: Describe how you would describe _____ in five years' time.
full_sentence: Describe how you would describe yourself in five years' time.

questions: Give us some idea of what you believe are your _____ and weaknesses.
full_sentence: Give us some idea of what you believe are your strengths and weaknesses.

questions: As this is a managerial post, we must ask you how you deal with bad _____ keeping or unpunctuality in an employee.
full_sentence: As this is a managerial post, we must ask you how you deal with bad time keeping or unpunctuality in an employee.

questions: Imagine one of your staff loses her temper and shouts at you in front of others, how would you _____ with this?
full_sentence: Imagine one of your staff loses her temper and shouts at you in front of others, how would you deal with this?

questions: What would you say to a member of your staff who always _____ his work in late?
full_sentence: What would you say to a member of your staff who always handed his work in late?

questions: I should explain that we would naturally _____ any previous holiday arrangements you have made.
full_sentence: I should explain that we would naturally honour any previous holiday arrangements you have made.

questions: Finally now that we've asked you several questions, do you want to _____ any to us?
full_sentence: Finally now that we've asked you several questions, do you want to put any to us?

questions: If you drive faster than the stated speed limit, you are simply _____ the law.
full_sentence: If you drive faster than the stated speed limit, you are simply breaking the law.

questions: However angry you may get at what someone has done to you, the police always advise you not to take the law into your own _____.
full_sentence: However angry you may get at what someone has done to you, the police always advise you not to take the law into your own hands.

questions: In London in any underground station it is _____ the law to smoke.
full_sentence: In London in any underground station it is against the law to smoke.

questions: Even if you think you may have got away with a crime, in most cases the long _____ of the law will catch you.
full_sentence: Even if you think you may have got away with a crime, in most cases the long arm of the law will catch you.

questions: In that particular industry everyone has to look after themselves because the law of the _____ rules.
full_sentence: In that particular industry everyone has to look after themselves because the law of the jungle rules.

questions: They have no respect for modern conventions and do exactly what they want - they are a law _____ themselves.
full_sentence: They have no respect for modern conventions and do exactly what they want - they are a law unto themselves.

questions: Her parents are very strict and frequently _____ down the law about the way she behaves.
full_sentence: Her parents are very strict and frequently lay down the law about the way she behaves.

questions: Although technically his judgement was not according to the _____ of the law, most people thought the judge was right to let the man go free.
full_sentence: Although technically his judgement was not according to the letter of the law, most people thought the judge was right to let the man go free.

questions: I get the impression sometimes that she thinks she can never do anything wrong almost as if she is _____ the law.
full_sentence: I get the impression sometimes that she thinks she can never do anything wrong almost as if she is above the law.

questions: All governments want people to live in peace and comfort and so they try to promote a sense of law and _____.
full_sentence: All governments want people to live in peace and comfort and so they try to promote a sense of law and order.

questions: I am writing this letter to you as a sort of last _____ since all my attempts to phone you
full_sentence: I am writing this letter to you as a sort of last resort since all my attempts to phone you

questions: and to try and make an _____ to meet you and discuss my problem with you have been unsuccessful.
full_sentence: and to try and make an appointment to meet you and discuss my problem with you have been unsuccessful.

questions: I would like to tell you the story from the _____ beginning.
full_sentence: I would like to tell you the story from the very beginning.

questions: In January this year I bought a washing machine from you for which I paid _____
full_sentence: In January this year I bought a washing machine from you for which I paid cash

questions: and made _____ for it to be delivered to my home in Southcote on the following Tuesday.
full_sentence: and made arrangements for it to be delivered to my home in Southcote on the following Tuesday.

questions: I stayed in all day on _____ as you had informed me that you could not be sure at what time of day the washing machine would arrive.
full_sentence: I stayed in all day on purpose as you had informed me that you could not be sure at what time of day the washing machine would arrive.

questions: In the end nobody came that day. When I phoned, I was told it _____ come the following Tuesday.
full_sentence: In the end nobody came that day. When I phoned, I was told it would come the following Tuesday.

questions: Again I stayed in all day in _____ and there was no delivery.
full_sentence: Again I stayed in all day in vain and there was no delivery.

questions: After six more phone calls I _____ succeeded in settling on a date
full_sentence: After six more phone calls I eventually succeeded in settling on a date

questions: and the machine came on Tuesday February 20th - almost 5 weeks after the _____ delivery date.
full_sentence: and the machine came on Tuesday February 20th - almost 5 weeks after the promised delivery date.

questions: I had the washing machine fitted by a _____ plumber but he was unable to make the thing work.
full_sentence: I had the washing machine fitted by a reputable plumber but he was unable to make the thing work.

questions: _____ one of the components was faulty and he recommended that I got back to you so that a replacement could be fitted.
full_sentence: Apparently one of the components was faulty and he recommended that I got back to you so that a replacement could be fitted.

questions: When I telephoned your store and explained the _____ to your receptionist,
full_sentence: When I telephoned your store and explained the situation to your receptionist,

questions: I was _____ with the comment, 'Oh not you again'
full_sentence: I was greeted with the comment, 'Oh not you again'

questions: which I found most _____ especially since throughout the protracted period of waiting for the machine
full_sentence: which I found most offensive especially since throughout the protracted period of waiting for the machine

questions: I remained calm although I believe I have every reason for _____ up a fuss.
full_sentence: I remained calm although I believe I have every reason for kicking up a fuss.

questions: I eventually got put _____ to the technical department
full_sentence: I eventually got put through to the technical department

questions: who were most _____ hand
full_sentence: who were most off hand

questions: and told me there was _____ that could be done immediately
full_sentence: and told me there was little that could be done immediately

questions: since there were a number of people _____ sick.
full_sentence: since there were a number of people off sick.

questions: We now move on to late March when I imagine that the sick employees were fully _____
full_sentence: We now move on to late March when I imagine that the sick employees were fully recovered

questions: and one of your technical staff came out to see me with the intention of replacing the _____ part.
full_sentence: and one of your technical staff came out to see me with the intention of replacing the defective part.

questions: Unfortunately he had _____ the wrong part with him
full_sentence: Unfortunately he had brought the wrong part with him

questions: and was very _____ as to when he would be able to find the right part and get it back to me.
full_sentence: and was very unsure as to when he would be able to find the right part and get it back to me.

questions: Another visit took _____ in late April but the engineer, although he had got the right part with him, was unable to make the washing machine work.
full_sentence: Another visit took place in late April but the engineer, although he had got the right part with him, was unable to make the washing machine work.

questions: It was at this stage that I was seriously considering getting _____ of the machine
full_sentence: It was at this stage that I was seriously considering getting rid of the machine

questions: and asking for a _____
full_sentence: and asking for a refund

questions: When I _____ this matter with one of your staff
full_sentence: When I raised this matter with one of your staff

questions: I was informed that this was out of the _____
full_sentence: I was informed that this was out of the question

questions: They would send someone in the _____ future.
full_sentence: They would send someone in the near future.

questions: At the beginning of May I decided that the only course of action was to _____ a visit to your store
full_sentence: At the beginning of May I decided that the only course of action was to pay a visit to your store

questions: and meet you face to face so that the matter could be settled once and for _____.
full_sentence: and meet you face to face so that the matter could be settled once and for all.

questions: _____ I should have checked first since when I reached the shop I was led to believe that you were out for the day.
full_sentence: Admittedly I should have checked first since when I reached the shop I was led to believe that you were out for the day.

questions: Throughout this time of course I have been without the _____ of a washing machine
full_sentence: Throughout this time of course I have been without the facility of a washing machine

questions: and have had to use the local _____.
full_sentence: and have had to use the local launderette.

questions: From the end of May until August I have been away on business and was surprised that _____ that period
full_sentence: From the end of May until August I have been away on business and was surprised that during that period

questions: no effort has been made to write to me and keep me _____ to date.
full_sentence: no effort has been made to write to me and keep me up to date.

questions: Since returning in September I have made at least a dozen phone calls and quite frankly I have reached the end of my _____.
full_sentence: Since returning in September I have made at least a dozen phone calls and quite frankly I have reached the end of my tether.

questions: and must _____ that you do something immediately to put the matter right.
full_sentence: and must insist that you do something immediately to put the matter right.

questions: If I do not hear from you by the end of this week I shall be forced to _____ legal advice.
full_sentence: If I do not hear from you by the end of this week I shall be forced to seek legal advice.

questions: It's useful when you go to an auction if you're ready with cash in _____.
full_sentence: It's useful when you go to an auction if you're ready with cash in hand.

questions: I prefer to deal in _____ cash rather than cheques.
full_sentence: I prefer to deal in hard cash rather than cheques.

questions: Every office has a certain amount of _____ cash to pay for things like tea, coffee or stamps.
full_sentence: Every office has a certain amount of petty cash to pay for things like tea, coffee or stamps.

questions: At the moment we are experiencing some cash _____ problems because little money is coming in.
full_sentence: At the moment we are experiencing some cash flow problems because little money is coming in.

questions: At the casino you can cash _____ your chips at the desk.
full_sentence: At the casino you can cash in your chips at the desk.

questions: Whatever she does, she just can't help _____ money.
full_sentence: Whatever she does, she just can't help making money.

questions: There doesn't seem to be anyone working really hard for the business and yet they all seem to earn _____ money.
full_sentence: There doesn't seem to be anyone working really hard for the business and yet they all seem to earn easy money.

questions: If you don't want to use a cheque or postal order, you can always use a money _____.
full_sentence: If you don't want to use a cheque or postal order, you can always use a money order.

questions: That new invention has been very successful and has proved to be a money _____ for its creator.
full_sentence: That new invention has been very successful and has proved to be a money spinner for its creator.

questions: This machine is obviously useless and if I were you I'd get your money _____.
full_sentence: This machine is obviously useless and if I were you I'd get your money back.

questions: Even after their recent heavy expenses, they still found there was a healthy _____ in their bank account.
full_sentence: Even after their recent heavy expenses, they still found there was a healthy balance in their bank account.
