questions: As the builder wanted cash for the work he had done, she had to go to the bank personally to _____ the money herself.
full_sentence: As the builder wanted cash for the work he had done, she had to go to the bank personally to take out the money herself.

questions: It was considered a very good time to apply for a _____ to buy the house because interest rates were very low.
full_sentence: It was considered a very good time to apply for a mortgage to buy the house because interest rates were very low.

questions: Before they could borrow a large sum of money to buy the house, they had to make sure they had enough money to be able to make a _____ payment.
full_sentence: Before they could borrow a large sum of money to buy the house, they had to make sure they had enough money to be able to make a down payment.

questions: All the _____ you make on your internet account are recorded so that you can check the details at any time.
full_sentence: All the transactions you make on your internet account are recorded so that you can check the details at any time.

questions: I'm afraid this cheque will be of no value until you have put your _____ on it.
full_sentence: I'm afraid this cheque will be of no value until you have put your signature on it.

questions: The bank refused to _____ the money order because the customer had no proof of identity.
full_sentence: The bank refused to accept the money order because the customer had no proof of identity.

questions: Under the rules laid down by the bank there is a _____ on the amount of money you can get out from a cash machine in any one day.
full_sentence: Under the rules laid down by the bank there is a restriction on the amount of money you can get out from a cash machine in any one day.

questions: The bank clerk at the counter did not know the customer and in view of the large amount of money involved was naturally _____ about paying out the sum on the cheque.
full_sentence: The bank clerk at the counter did not know the customer and in view of the large amount of money involved was naturally cautious about paying out the sum on the cheque.

questions: The bank will simply not let you _____ any money unless you can prove that you have been in regular employment for at least three years.
full_sentence: The bank will simply not let you borrow any money unless you can prove that you have been in regular employment for at least three years.

questions: Good _____ procedures are very important if you want to run a business profitably and successfully.
full_sentence: Good accounting procedures are very important if you want to run a business profitably and successfully.

questions: The company fell heavily into _____ when it took on too many customers and offered them all cheap warranties.
full_sentence: The company fell heavily into debt when it took on too many customers and offered them all cheap warranties.

questions: Once you have built up your company, you must remember to keep in touch with your original _____.
full_sentence: Once you have built up your company, you must remember to keep in touch with your original clients.

questions: Each department within the organisation is given a _____ within which it has to remain for the whole year.
full_sentence: Each department within the organisation is given a budget within which it has to remain for the whole year.

questions: When the time came to close the business down, its entire _____ had to be calculated so that the creditors could be paid off.
full_sentence: When the time came to close the business down, its entire assets had to be calculated so that the creditors could be paid off.

questions: The manager called in her chief clerk because she could not _____ the figures on the monthly spreadsheet.
full_sentence: The manager called in her chief clerk because she could not reconcile the figures on the monthly spreadsheet.

questions: Every year the college finance officer did not look forward to the visit from the government official who came to _____ the accounts.
full_sentence: Every year the college finance officer did not look forward to the visit from the government official who came to audit the accounts.

questions: It was a great relief to Charlie when he realized that he had come to the end of his agreement with the bank and there was only one _____ payment left.
full_sentence: It was a great relief to Charlie when he realized that he had come to the end of his agreement with the bank and there was only one outstanding payment left.

questions: The building society sent a letter to all its savers and _____ that there would be a reduction in the interest rate.
full_sentence: The building society sent a letter to all its savers and borrowers that there would be a reduction in the interest rate.

questions: Shortly after the couple had bought their first house, they saw the number of bills _____ rapidly.
full_sentence: Shortly after the couple had bought their first house, they saw the number of bills accumulate rapidly.

questions: The representative of the financial consultants assured her that the policy of the firm was that of complete _____.
full_sentence: The representative of the financial consultants assured her that the policy of the firm was that of complete commitment.

questions: There is no need to worry about the money side of the project because _____ are available from the charity sponsoring us.
full_sentence: There is no need to worry about the money side of the project because funds are available from the charity sponsoring us.

questions: The present finance minister has adopted a very _____ approach towards change and always follows a very cautious policy.
full_sentence: The present finance minister has adopted a very conservative approach towards change and always follows a very cautious policy.

questions: As all advisers always do, she stressed that investing in this particular market had to be considered as a _____ commitment over at least 10 years.
full_sentence: As all advisers always do, she stressed that investing in this particular market had to be considered as a long-term commitment over at least 10 years.

questions: The best way to develop an income for the future is to invest in a series of companies and in that way to build up a _____.
full_sentence: The best way to develop an income for the future is to invest in a series of companies and in that way to build up a portfolio.

questions: I strongly recommend investing in these shares because you will get a very good _____ after only a few years.
full_sentence: I strongly recommend investing in these shares because you will get a very good return after only a few years.

questions: The question is whether it is _____ to sell up all your shares at this stage rather than wait to see how the market is next year.
full_sentence: The question is whether it is wise to sell up all your shares at this stage rather than wait to see how the market is next year.

questions: There is no question that the most important _____ in that company is its youthful enthusiasm.
full_sentence: There is no question that the most important resource in that company is its youthful enthusiasm.

questions: If you want to make a good job of selling shares to the public, you must have an element of _____ in your approach.
full_sentence: If you want to make a good job of selling shares to the public, you must have an element of aggression in your approach.

questions: It's a personal matter whether you choose stock from this company or from that because in the end it's an _____ of mind.
full_sentence: It's a personal matter whether you choose stock from this company or from that because in the end it's an attitude of mind.

questions: There is one date you mustn't forget and that's the _____ for sending in details of your earnings to the tax office.
full_sentence: There is one date you mustn't forget and that's the deadline for sending in details of your earnings to the tax office.

questions: If you are self-employed, you must make sure that you _____ the form indicating how much you have earned.
full_sentence: If you are self-employed, you must make sure that you fill out the form indicating how much you have earned.

questions: If the department agrees that you have paid too much tax in the year, you will receive a _____ in due course.
full_sentence: If the department agrees that you have paid too much tax in the year, you will receive a refund in due course.

questions: Each month when you receive your pay, the employer _____ a certain amount to pay towards your pension.
full_sentence: Each month when you receive your pay, the employer withholds a certain amount to pay towards your pension.

questions: When you take out a loan, you have to pay interest on the amount you _____.
full_sentence: When you take out a loan, you have to pay interest on the amount you owe.

questions: In the tax office there will be a _____ that holds all the documents and papers connected with you.
full_sentence: In the tax office there will be a file that holds all the documents and papers connected with you.

questions: There is quite a heavy financial _____ attached to any action that involves late payment of taxes.
full_sentence: There is quite a heavy financial penalty attached to any action that involves late payment of taxes.

questions: Under the new regulations you can agree yourself to _____ the tax you have to pay on the income over the previous year.
full_sentence: Under the new regulations you can agree yourself to calculate the tax you have to pay on the income over the previous year.

questions: As the couple had a _____ account, the money to pay the mortage was taken from there.
full_sentence: As the couple had a joint account, the money to pay the mortage was taken from there.

questions: You can decide, if you so wish, to _____ your right to take your pension at an earlier date.
full_sentence: You can decide, if you so wish, to give up your right to take your pension at an earlier date.

questions: Mary: Did you know there are _____ of slang words for money, like bread for example?
full_sentence: Mary: Did you know there are loads of slang words for money, like bread for example?

questions: John: I suppose there are when you _____ to think about it - like dough, which is similar to your word bread.
full_sentence: John: I suppose there are when you come to think about it - like dough, which is similar to your word bread.

questions: Mary: One of my _____ is dosh. I like the sound of it.
full_sentence: Mary: One of my favourites is dosh. I like the sound of it.

questions: John: Well if you're _____ to sound. What about spondulicks?
full_sentence: John: Well if you're referring to sound. What about spondulicks?

questions: Mary: Yes, that's excellent. Another short sound that _____ to me is brass.
full_sentence: Mary: Yes, that's excellent. Another short sound that appeals to me is brass.

questions: John: Another one that _____ with jolly is the word lolly.
full_sentence: John: Another one that rhymes with jolly is the word lolly.

questions: Mary: An expression which sounds very _____ of course is filthy lucre.
full_sentence: Mary: An expression which sounds very decadent of course is filthy lucre.

questions: John: That's true and then there's that word that also has the same _____ as something that's been stolen - loot.
full_sentence: John: That's true and then there's that word that also has the same meaning as something that's been stolen - loot.

questions: Mary: The one that sounds very grand because it in a way _____ the fact that it means money and that's the wherewithal.
full_sentence: Mary: The one that sounds very grand because it in a way hides the fact that it means money and that's the wherewithal.

questions: John: Actually, I'm a little _____ about this but I haven't any money to pay for the bus home. Do you think you could lend me some readies?
full_sentence: John: Actually, I'm a little embarrassed about this but I haven't any money to pay for the bus home. Do you think you could lend me some readies?

questions: She was going to discuss the matter _____ with her colleagues or her family.
full_sentence: She was going to discuss the matter either with her colleagues or her family.

questions: Our project team tried hard to think _____ all the possible alternatives before making a decision.
full_sentence: Our project team tried hard to think of all the possible alternatives before making a decision.

questions: Timing can be _____ crucial when you're considering launching a new online marketing campaign.
full_sentence: Timing can be extremely crucial when you're considering launching a new online marketing campaign.

questions: Are you able to _____ our conditions of delivery in line with our recent invoice?
full_sentence: Are you able to accept our conditions of delivery in line with our recent invoice?

questions: Fortunately for us we're finding our new internet division is showing an increased _____.
full_sentence: Fortunately for us we're finding our new internet division is showing an increased profit.

questions: Following some recent research our engineers _____ that our index system has scope for fast improvement.
full_sentence: Following some recent research our engineers found that our index system has scope for fast improvement.

questions: In our line of business it is vital to host our website on our own server _____ of getting someone else to do it.
full_sentence: In our line of business it is vital to host our website on our own server instead of getting someone else to do it.

questions: Before you employ new staff you should carry out a _____ examination of their personal qualities and professional experience.
full_sentence: Before you employ new staff you should carry out a careful examination of their personal qualities and professional experience.

questions: Thanks to the high standards of service we offer our customers, we have been able to establish an excellent _____.
full_sentence: Thanks to the high standards of service we offer our customers, we have been able to establish an excellent reputation.

questions: An interactive website can save your organisation _____ amounts of time and money that would otherwise be spent on correspondence.
full_sentence: An interactive website can save your organisation significant amounts of time and money that would otherwise be spent on correspondence.

questions: On the _____ of her ten years' service she immediately qualified for the extended annual leave of six weeks.
full_sentence: On the basis of her ten years' service she immediately qualified for the extended annual leave of six weeks.

questions: Although he knew it was a sensitive subject, his boss had to ask him the _____ question about his drink problem.
full_sentence: Although he knew it was a sensitive subject, his boss had to ask him the delicate question about his drink problem.

questions: At the interview each applicant was able to _____ the level of remuneration they would be expecting to receive.
full_sentence: At the interview each applicant was able to negotiate the level of remuneration they would be expecting to receive.

questions: Under the new _____ arrangements coming into force soon all employees can decide what time to start and when to finish.
full_sentence: Under the new flexible arrangements coming into force soon all employees can decide what time to start and when to finish.

questions: According to the contract you are not _____ for the new allowance until you have been with the company one year.
full_sentence: According to the contract you are not eligible for the new allowance until you have been with the company one year.

questions: The only way you can hope to _____ the level of your pay is to take on greater responsibility.
full_sentence: The only way you can hope to raise the level of your pay is to take on greater responsibility.

questions: She is trying to get some form of _____ to make up for the poor working conditions she had to put up with for all those years.
full_sentence: She is trying to get some form of compensation to make up for the poor working conditions she had to put up with for all those years.

questions: Of course there is a little extra added to your salary because you will _____ from the inner city allowance.
full_sentence: Of course there is a little extra added to your salary because you will benefit from the inner city allowance.

questions: The hourly _____ for all part time clerical assistants has gone up by 40% since 2000.
full_sentence: The hourly wage for all part time clerical assistants has gone up by 40% since 2000.

questions: Remember when you stop work and _____, you will be able to receive the company pension.
full_sentence: Remember when you stop work and retire, you will be able to receive the company pension.

questions: It is essential before starting a business to work on a plan to _____ problems later on.
full_sentence: It is essential before starting a business to work on a plan to avoid problems later on.

questions: The biggest _____ in business can be eliminated if you have sufficient capital to start with.
full_sentence: The biggest risk in business can be eliminated if you have sufficient capital to start with.

questions: Even when the economic situation is _____, there is always present the need for planning in a new business.
full_sentence: Even when the economic situation is strong, there is always present the need for planning in a new business.

questions: Whatever happens in the future there is absolutely no _____ for good market research before you launch a new product.
full_sentence: Whatever happens in the future there is absolutely no substitute for good market research before you launch a new product.

questions: Your _____ concern is naturally the plan but don't forget your capital or your premises.
full_sentence: Your primary concern is naturally the plan but don't forget your capital or your premises.

questions: When people are considering whether to loan your new business a substantial sum, they are going to _____ your potential.
full_sentence: When people are considering whether to loan your new business a substantial sum, they are going to evaluate your potential.

questions: It is worthwhile _____ as much market research information as possible before you work out your plan.
full_sentence: It is worthwhile gathering as much market research information as possible before you work out your plan.

questions: Her next task was to have a meeting with the bank manager to _____ that she had a secure enough plan to warrant a loan.
full_sentence: Her next task was to have a meeting with the bank manager to demonstrate that she had a secure enough plan to warrant a loan.

questions: There are certain weaknesses in your plan that need to be _____ urgently if you are to succeed.
full_sentence: There are certain weaknesses in your plan that need to be addressed urgently if you are to succeed.

questions: Since the start of the business many new ideas have _____ out of the original plan.
full_sentence: Since the start of the business many new ideas have developed out of the original plan.

questions: Before the product is put on the market, the company must _____ whether it complies with safety standards.
full_sentence: Before the product is put on the market, the company must ascertain whether it complies with safety standards.

questions: It is absolutely essential to do some thorough _____ before you even think of putting a new product on the market.
full_sentence: It is absolutely essential to do some thorough research before you even think of putting a new product on the market.

questions: You have a _____ to the public to ensure your toy products are suitable for children to play with.
full_sentence: You have a responsibility to the public to ensure your toy products are suitable for children to play with.

questions: The company is busy trying to _____ the problems arising from the sudden drop in sales of their cosmetic products.
full_sentence: The company is busy trying to solve the problems arising from the sudden drop in sales of their cosmetic products.

questions: The job of the _____ of this particular section is to train the members to deal politely with any complaints from the public.
full_sentence: The job of the organizer of this particular section is to train the members to deal politely with any complaints from the public.

questions: Inspiration has its place in any form of product development but at the same time you also need to adopt some kind of _____ approach.
full_sentence: Inspiration has its place in any form of product development but at the same time you also need to adopt some kind of systematic approach.

questions: A _____ approach to new ideas is to be welcomed but you do need a strong element of imagination as well.
full_sentence: A logical approach to new ideas is to be welcomed but you do need a strong element of imagination as well.

questions: Since 1993 or if you like within the last _____, there have been many products that have failed because of poor marketing.
full_sentence: Since 1993 or if you like within the last decade, there have been many products that have failed because of poor marketing.

questions: We would definitely like to _____ the proposal you have presented to us with a view to including it in our current range of products.
full_sentence: We would definitely like to examine the proposal you have presented to us with a view to including it in our current range of products.

questions: As we have enough money in our present budget, we are happy to launch this new product in the nature of an _____.
full_sentence: As we have enough money in our present budget, we are happy to launch this new product in the nature of an experiment.

questions: The reason why I always buy my clothes at this store is because all the _____ they sell are of very high quality.
full_sentence: The reason why I always buy my clothes at this store is because all the brands they sell are of very high quality.

questions: Before these articles leave the factory to be forwarded to the retailer, each one is thoroughly _____.
full_sentence: Before these articles leave the factory to be forwarded to the retailer, each one is thoroughly inspected.

questions: The advantages of working for this company is that all employees _____ themselves as a member of the team.
full_sentence: The advantages of working for this company is that all employees perceive themselves as a member of the team.

questions: If for any reason customers do not like the item they have bought, they always _____ and get a refund.
full_sentence: If for any reason customers do not like the item they have bought, they always take it back and get a refund.

questions: The great thing about this particular material is that however much you screw it up, it never _____.
full_sentence: The great thing about this particular material is that however much you screw it up, it never wrinkles.

questions: The company insists that all their products are _____ in respect of their quality, specification and look.
full_sentence: The company insists that all their products are uniform in respect of their quality, specification and look.

questions: This is the department for children's clothes and each _____ is marked with the recommended age range.
full_sentence: This is the department for children's clothes and each garment is marked with the recommended age range.

questions: The sole purpose of this jacket is to _____ water and if you wear it in the rain and still get wet, it's useless.
full_sentence: The sole purpose of this jacket is to repel water and if you wear it in the rain and still get wet, it's useless.

questions: The whole look of the shop front is _____ by the introduction of bright colours.
full_sentence: The whole look of the shop front is enhanced by the introduction of bright colours.

questions: These pots are being sold as seconds because each one has a slight _____ in the glaze.
full_sentence: These pots are being sold as seconds because each one has a slight defect in the glaze.

questions: If you ask someone for their _____ on supermarkets as opposed to the small corner shop, you will get varying replies.
full_sentence: If you ask someone for their stance on supermarkets as opposed to the small corner shop, you will get varying replies.

questions: The first question you have to ask is who are the customers that they are each trying to _____.
full_sentence: The first question you have to ask is who are the customers that they are each trying to target.

questions: When you tell the inhabitants of a small village that the little local store is going to close, many will express _____.
full_sentence: When you tell the inhabitants of a small village that the little local store is going to close, many will express dismay.

questions: There will naturally be _____ in the various sections of the community as to the benefits or disadvantages of losing the little store.
full_sentence: There will naturally be splits in the various sections of the community as to the benefits or disadvantages of losing the little store.

questions: Of course we all get _____ with endless leaflets through the door telling us of bargains at the local supermarket.
full_sentence: Of course we all get plagued with endless leaflets through the door telling us of bargains at the local supermarket.

questions: Big discussions take place in the area as to whether a supermarket will come to the area and waiting for the outcome can be quite _____ for the small shop owner.
full_sentence: Big discussions take place in the area as to whether a supermarket will come to the area and waiting for the outcome can be quite nerve racking for the small shop owner.

questions: Inquiries are held which seem to go on forever and you only wish that the procedure could be _____.
full_sentence: Inquiries are held which seem to go on forever and you only wish that the procedure could be speeded up.

questions: Protest meetings are held but invariably they end in a _____ because they are not organized properly.
full_sentence: Protest meetings are held but invariably they end in a shambles because they are not organized properly.

questions: Then the final result is announced that there is to be a _____ between EASISHOP and GOSHOP, which will then become a super supermarket.
full_sentence: Then the final result is announced that there is to be a merger between EASISHOP and GOSHOP, which will then become a super supermarket.

questions: The confused customer is now in a terrible _____ because in the old days there was just one brand of butter to buy and now there is a choice of 24.
full_sentence: The confused customer is now in a terrible dilemma because in the old days there was just one brand of butter to buy and now there is a choice of 24.

questions: If you are self-employed, it is your responsibility to _____ how much tax you should legally pay.
full_sentence: If you are self-employed, it is your responsibility to calculate how much tax you should legally pay.

questions: I had a letter from the office of the Collector of Taxes telling me that I had to pay back all the money I _____ over the last 3 years.
full_sentence: I had a letter from the office of the Collector of Taxes telling me that I had to pay back all the money I owed over the last 3 years.

questions: The arrangement they have is that all the money that has to be paid in tax out of their earnings comes from their _____ account.
full_sentence: The arrangement they have is that all the money that has to be paid in tax out of their earnings comes from their joint account.

questions: Under the current legislation if you are late in paying your taxes, then you have to face a financial _____.
full_sentence: Under the current legislation if you are late in paying your taxes, then you have to face a financial penalty.

questions: He is in a terrible rush to complete his tax returns by Tuesday otherwise he won't be able to reach the _____.
full_sentence: He is in a terrible rush to complete his tax returns by Tuesday otherwise he won't be able to reach the deadline.

questions: It doesn't happen very often but I actually got some money from the tax office and with the _____ I'm going to treat myself.
full_sentence: It doesn't happen very often but I actually got some money from the tax office and with the refund I'm going to treat myself.

questions: Before you can claim any money back on overpayment of tax, you have to _____ an application form.
full_sentence: Before you can claim any money back on overpayment of tax, you have to fill out an application form.

questions: You can elect, if you want, to transfer your tax free allowance to your _____.
full_sentence: You can elect, if you want, to transfer your tax free allowance to your spouse.

questions: Until it's clearly established which tax group you are in, your employer will be asked to _____ a certain amount of your pay.
full_sentence: Until it's clearly established which tax group you are in, your employer will be asked to withhold a certain amount of your pay.

questions: There have been so many queries about his tax situation that there is now a huge _____ containing the details in the office.
full_sentence: There have been so many queries about his tax situation that there is now a huge file containing the details in the office.

questions: Remember that this happened first and was _____ to the episode that happened afterwards.
full_sentence: Remember that this happened first and was prior to the episode that happened afterwards.

questions: As the police saw the accident themselves, the driver avoided the _____ of having to give a detailed report.
full_sentence: As the police saw the accident themselves, the driver avoided the necessity of having to give a detailed report.

questions: It's a complete waste of time _____ over who was to blame, the main thing we have to do is decide what to do next.
full_sentence: It's a complete waste of time arguing over who was to blame, the main thing we have to do is decide what to do next.

questions: It was easy to realise why the machine had stopped working since it was a direct _____ of his failure to maintain it.
full_sentence: It was easy to realise why the machine had stopped working since it was a direct consequence of his failure to maintain it.

questions: I am completely confused as to why she did it and so it's not _____ to imagine why other people are mystified, too.
full_sentence: I am completely confused as to why she did it and so it's not difficult to imagine why other people are mystified, too.

questions: If you want to try and influence that political party it's best to become a member yourself and then you can argue from the _____.
full_sentence: If you want to try and influence that political party it's best to become a member yourself and then you can argue from the inside.

questions: I have great _____ for them at this time because I have had a similar experience.
full_sentence: I have great sympathy for them at this time because I have had a similar experience.

questions: Feel free to visit anything of interest to you in the exhibition and also you can _____ of any of the refreshments available.
full_sentence: Feel free to visit anything of interest to you in the exhibition and also you can partake of any of the refreshments available.

questions: Many of the people in the crowd were visibly crying because they all _____ with those who had lost relatives in the disaster.
full_sentence: Many of the people in the crowd were visibly crying because they all sympathized with those who had lost relatives in the disaster.

questions: I assure you that you will have no problem with the task because it's as easy _____ can be.
full_sentence: I assure you that you will have no problem with the task because it's as easy as can be.

questions: If you want my honest opinion, I thought the play was _____.
full_sentence: If you want my honest opinion, I thought the play was rubbish.

questions: It was quite a good film but I thought the characters were a bit like _____.
full_sentence: It was quite a good film but I thought the characters were a bit like cardboard.

questions: It's quite a nice car but there was not very much _____ in the back.
full_sentence: It's quite a nice car but there was not very much room in the back.

questions: She's pleasant enough but not very pretty. In fact I'd say she was rather _____.
full_sentence: She's pleasant enough but not very pretty. In fact I'd say she was rather plain.

questions: The first time you see the view you can't believe it. It almost takes your breath _____.
full_sentence: The first time you see the view you can't believe it. It almost takes your breath away.

questions: I sat through the concert feeling really bored and sleepy and had to stop myself from _____ several times.
full_sentence: I sat through the concert feeling really bored and sleepy and had to stop myself from yawning several times.

questions: It was one of the most embarrassing moments of my life and I just wanted the ground to _____ up and swallow me.
full_sentence: It was one of the most embarrassing moments of my life and I just wanted the ground to open up and swallow me.

questions: In my opinion no one in their right mind would ever go and pay to see a play _____ that.
full_sentence: In my opinion no one in their right mind would ever go and pay to see a play like that.

questions: The room was good, the bed was comfortable and the service was excellent but the hotel food left a lot to be _____.
full_sentence: The room was good, the bed was comfortable and the service was excellent but the hotel food left a lot to be desired.

questions: To be perfectly honest with you I think that this is the best test I've ever taken in my entire _____.
full_sentence: To be perfectly honest with you I think that this is the best test I've ever taken in my entire life.

questions: I'll have to _____ company with you there, I'm afraid.
full_sentence: I'll have to part company with you there, I'm afraid.

questions: There's no way I can _____ that.
full_sentence: There's no way I can accept that.

questions: We'll have to agree to _____ over that.
full_sentence: We'll have to agree to differ over that.

questions: Don't even think about it! I can't possibly take that on _____.
full_sentence: Don't even think about it! I can't possibly take that on board.

questions: No matter how _____ you are, I won't change my mind.
full_sentence: No matter how persuasive you are, I won't change my mind.

questions: You can't talk until the _____ come home. I won't accept that scheme.
full_sentence: You can't talk until the cows come home. I won't accept that scheme.

questions: Sorry the subject is now _____.
full_sentence: Sorry the subject is now closed.

questions: I regret I have no choice but to reject the plan out of _____.
full_sentence: I regret I have no choice but to reject the plan out of hand.

questions: No matter how much you object, I am _____ I am right and you're wrong.
full_sentence: No matter how much you object, I am convinced I am right and you're wrong.

questions: You might as well admit it! You haven't a _____ to stand on.
full_sentence: You might as well admit it! You haven't a leg to stand on.

questions: There is no way that I can agree to you _____ early today.
full_sentence: There is no way that I can agree to you leaving early today.

questions: I must object and make it clear that I am totally _____ any measures that suggest changes to the original scheme.
full_sentence: I must object and make it clear that I am totally against any measures that suggest changes to the original scheme.

questions: He has the _____ of always rejecting any idea that will change the current arrangements.
full_sentence: He has the habit of always rejecting any idea that will change the current arrangements.

questions: I cannot condone that sort of _____ in my establishment and would ask you to remember that in future.
full_sentence: I cannot condone that sort of behaviour in my establishment and would ask you to remember that in future.

questions: I have no choice really but to turn _____ your recent proposal because it is completely unworkable.
full_sentence: I have no choice really but to turn down your recent proposal because it is completely unworkable.

questions: They can't possibly go _____ with your suggestions because it will involve too much expenditure.
full_sentence: They can't possibly go along with your suggestions because it will involve too much expenditure.

questions: Quite honestly I'd have to be out of my _____ to sanction what is a crazy proposition.
full_sentence: Quite honestly I'd have to be out of my mind to sanction what is a crazy proposition.

questions: When her father discovered that his daughter wanted to marry a pop singer, he decided to put every _____ in their way to prevent the marriage.
full_sentence: When her father discovered that his daughter wanted to marry a pop singer, he decided to put every obstacle in their way to prevent the marriage.

questions: He told me there was definitely no _____ that I would pass my examination until I did some work.
full_sentence: He told me there was definitely no chance that I would pass my examination until I did some work.

questions: You could tell by the _____ he refused to smile that he didn't like the story.
full_sentence: You could tell by the way he refused to smile that he didn't like the story.

questions: Great to see you again. I haven't seen you _____ ages.
full_sentence: Great to see you again. I haven't seen you for ages.

questions: Welcome to our house. Come in and make yourself _____.
full_sentence: Welcome to our house. Come in and make yourself comfortable.

questions: How do you do? I don't think we've met _____.
full_sentence: How do you do? I don't think we've met before.

questions: Hi Mary. Where have you been _____ yourself all this time?
full_sentence: Hi Mary. Where have you been hiding yourself all this time?

questions: Good morning, sir. I hope you will have an enjoyable _____ in our hotel.
full_sentence: Good morning, sir. I hope you will have an enjoyable stay in our hotel.

questions: Good evening to you all. Let me find you a _____ near the window.
full_sentence: Good evening to you all. Let me find you a table near the window.

questions: How are you, David.? I must _____ you're looking very well.
full_sentence: How are you, David.? I must admit you're looking very well.

questions: Hello there. I just don't believe it. You haven't changed a _____ since we last met.
full_sentence: Hello there. I just don't believe it. You haven't changed a bit since we last met.

questions: Ah, you must be Mary's husband. Do come in and _____ everyone.
full_sentence: Ah, you must be Mary's husband. Do come in and meet everyone.

questions: Here you are at last! I hope your _____ here wasn't too horrible.
full_sentence: Here you are at last! I hope your journey here wasn't too horrible.

questions: I've had just as much as I can _____ from you.
full_sentence: I've had just as much as I can stomach from you.

questions: You do that again and I'll _____ your head off.
full_sentence: You do that again and I'll bite your head off.

questions: I'm sorry but I can't take any more. I'm afraid I've reached _____ point.
full_sentence: I'm sorry but I can't take any more. I'm afraid I've reached screaming point.

questions: You just _____ touch that piece of paper and I'll kill you.
full_sentence: You just dare touch that piece of paper and I'll kill you.

questions: How many more times do I have to _____ it to you, stupid?
full_sentence: How many more times do I have to repeat it to you, stupid?

questions: I know you find this highly amusing but to me it's no _____ matter.
full_sentence: I know you find this highly amusing but to me it's no laughing matter.

questions: I'm warning you. I can take just that much and _____ more.
full_sentence: I'm warning you. I can take just that much and no more.

questions: Everybody just get _____ of my way and leave me alone.
full_sentence: Everybody just get out of my way and leave me alone.

questions: Not another word from either of you. That's _____.
full_sentence: Not another word from either of you. That's final.

questions: Right. I'm leaving. You can do whatever you like. I couldn't care _____.
full_sentence: Right. I'm leaving. You can do whatever you like. I couldn't care less.

questions: Now that's what I call absolutely _____.
full_sentence: Now that's what I call absolutely perfect.

questions: You couldn't have made that drink better if you'd _____.
full_sentence: You couldn't have made that drink better if you'd tried.

questions: What a delightful _____ those flowers give off when you touch them.
full_sentence: What a delightful scent those flowers give off when you touch them.

questions: Words just _____ me when I try to say how happy I am.
full_sentence: Words just fail me when I try to say how happy I am.

questions: I can _____ say that I don't think I've ever enjoyed myself so much before.
full_sentence: I can safely say that I don't think I've ever enjoyed myself so much before.

questions: There's really nothing like it, is there when you find you've _____ all the answers to the test right?
full_sentence: There's really nothing like it, is there when you find you've got all the answers to the test right?

questions: The only problem with your cooking is that the more I eat, the more I want _____ more.
full_sentence: The only problem with your cooking is that the more I eat, the more I want some more.

questions: I must be _____ because it's all too good to be true.
full_sentence: I must be dreaming because it's all too good to be true.

questions: Just let me try one more of your delicious chocolates and then I'll _____ not to take any more.
full_sentence: Just let me try one more of your delicious chocolates and then I'll promise not to take any more.

questions: It's absolute _____ here. I think I'll stay at this hotel one more week.
full_sentence: It's absolute bliss here. I think I'll stay at this hotel one more week.

questions: Words can't possibly _____ how grateful I am for what you have done.
full_sentence: Words can't possibly express how grateful I am for what you have done.

questions: Thank you so much for helping me. I really _____ it.
full_sentence: Thank you so much for helping me. I really appreciate it.

questions: A thousand thanks for all your hard work. I shall never _____ it.
full_sentence: A thousand thanks for all your hard work. I shall never forget it.

questions: They showed their great gratitude by sending us a large _____ of money.
full_sentence: They showed their great gratitude by sending us a large sum of money.

questions: Thank you for all you've done from the _____ of my heart.
full_sentence: Thank you for all you've done from the bottom of my heart.

questions: I'm sending this bunch of flowers as a small _____ of my thanks and appreciation.
full_sentence: I'm sending this bunch of flowers as a small token of my thanks and appreciation.

questions: How can I _____ thank you enough for all you've done?
full_sentence: How can I possibly thank you enough for all you've done?

questions: On the watch they gave him were the words: _____ gratitude for 40 years loyal service.
full_sentence: On the watch they gave him were the words: in gratitude for 40 years loyal service.

questions: It's very difficult for children to _____ their gratitude for what their parents have done for them.
full_sentence: It's very difficult for children to enclose their gratitude for what their parents have done for them.

questions: Look upon this as a _____ of thank you present for all your endeavours on our behalf.
full_sentence: Look upon this as a sort of thank you present for all your endeavours on our behalf.

questions: If I've _____ you once, I've done it a hundred times. Don't do it!
full_sentence: If I've told you once, I've done it a hundred times. Don't do it!

questions: I'll give you just one more _____ and after that, you'll be in real trouble.
full_sentence: I'll give you just one more chance and after that, you'll be in real trouble.

questions: I'm telling you loud and _____ that you really must get it right this time.
full_sentence: I'm telling you loud and clear that you really must get it right this time.

questions: She told him that if his manners didn't _____, he would be sent home.
full_sentence: She told him that if his manners didn't improve, he would be sent home.

questions: He agreed because he said it was like having a gun held to his _____.
full_sentence: He agreed because he said it was like having a gun held to his head.

questions: I'll lend you money for the very last time because after that you're on your _____.
full_sentence: I'll lend you money for the very last time because after that you're on your own.

questions: I can't tell you how lucky you've been this time but just _____ till next time.
full_sentence: I can't tell you how lucky you've been this time but just wait till next time.

questions: I'm prepared to _____ your mistake on this occasion but I can't ever do it again.
full_sentence: I'm prepared to overlook your mistake on this occasion but I can't ever do it again.

questions: If you leave me now, you don't _____ to come back.
full_sentence: If you leave me now, you don't need to come back.

questions: Let me put it simply one more incident like that and you're out on your _____!
full_sentence: Let me put it simply one more incident like that and you're out on your ear!

questions: The boss was appointed in the hope that she would be able to _____ results.
full_sentence: The boss was appointed in the hope that she would be able to achieve results.

questions: In the very beginning she had a meeting with all the staff, which turned out to be extremely _____.
full_sentence: In the very beginning she had a meeting with all the staff, which turned out to be extremely productive.

questions: Although many people wanted to remain _____ to her predecessor, they soon started to respect her style of managment.
full_sentence: Although many people wanted to remain loyal to her predecessor, they soon started to respect her style of managment.

questions: At the first series of interviews the question was whether to appoint a newcomer or _____ a current employee.
full_sentence: At the first series of interviews the question was whether to appoint a newcomer or promote a current employee.

questions: The decision was finally taken that appointments should be based purely and simply on _____.
full_sentence: The decision was finally taken that appointments should be based purely and simply on merit.

questions: There was a new spirit in the company and for the first time in ages staff at last felt they were being _____.
full_sentence: There was a new spirit in the company and for the first time in ages staff at last felt they were being valued.

questions: Employees were beginning to receive _____ for the hard work that they had been doing.
full_sentence: Employees were beginning to receive recognition for the hard work that they had been doing.

questions: It soon became apparent that under the new management people were also starting to _____ some of their free time to the company.
full_sentence: It soon became apparent that under the new management people were also starting to contribute some of their free time to the company.

questions: Some of the longest serving staff actually looked _____ to coming into work.
full_sentence: Some of the longest serving staff actually looked forward to coming into work.

questions: At the end of her first year it was _____ to everyone that as the new boss she had been totally accepted.
full_sentence: At the end of her first year it was obvious to everyone that as the new boss she had been totally accepted.

questions: Ray Alcorn of Park Real Estate Inc remarks that real estate is a capital-intensive industry, and its health rises and falls with capital availability; currently the capital markets are so _____ with cash, they can't find a place for it all.
full_sentence: Ray Alcorn of Park Real Estate Inc remarks that real estate is a capital-intensive industry, and its health rises and falls with capital availability; currently the capital markets are so flush with cash, they can't find a place for it all.

questions: Boom times typically engender oversupply of product, but construction prices have skyrocketed due to natural disasters and rising commodity prices, which has _____ new building in all property types.
full_sentence: Boom times typically engender oversupply of product, but construction prices have skyrocketed due to natural disasters and rising commodity prices, which has tempered new building in all property types.

questions: Rising consumer interest rates will further slow consumer purchasing and the housing market, and may produce the desired soft _____.
full_sentence: Rising consumer interest rates will further slow consumer purchasing and the housing market, and may produce the desired soft landing.

questions: Historically, contractions in capital have a negative effect on valuations, and current _____ from government regulators aiming to trim commercial banks' real estate loan exposure are worrisome.
full_sentence: Historically, contractions in capital have a negative effect on valuations, and current rumblings from government regulators aiming to trim commercial banks' real estate loan exposure are worrisome.

questions: Global markets are literally awash in capital, all of it seeking yield and stability; fortunately, commercial real estate offers both, and even if banks are constrained there is a _____ of capital to fill the void.
full_sentence: Global markets are literally awash in capital, all of it seeking yield and stability; fortunately, commercial real estate offers both, and even if banks are constrained there is a surfeit of capital to fill the void.

questions: Construction costs have gone through the _____ in the past year due to natural disasters and increased commodity prices.
full_sentence: Construction costs have gone through the roof in the past year due to natural disasters and increased commodity prices.

questions: High construction costs and condo conversions have reduced new supply and a slowing housing market increases rental demand, so owners can now flex their muscles with rent increases, and those who bought at high valuations may yet get the _____.
full_sentence: High construction costs and condo conversions have reduced new supply and a slowing housing market increases rental demand, so owners can now flex their muscles with rent increases, and those who bought at high valuations may yet get the last laugh.

questions: Areas with declining employment and population will experience an acceleration of those trends, and investors will not acquire properties in such markets without good reason to believe a comeback is in the _____.
full_sentence: Areas with declining employment and population will experience an acceleration of those trends, and investors will not acquire properties in such markets without good reason to believe a comeback is in the offing.

questions: Retail properties will suffer as owners rediscover risk as a component of value, but most of these assets are owned by well-capitalized private equity groups that can easily _____ the storm.
full_sentence: Retail properties will suffer as owners rediscover risk as a component of value, but most of these assets are owned by well-capitalized private equity groups that can easily ride out the storm.

questions: Acquisition of stabilized properties at low cap rates with little potential for rent growth is a sure _____ for below market returns.
full_sentence: Acquisition of stabilized properties at low cap rates with little potential for rent growth is a sure recipe for below market returns.

questions: Encarta's History of Advertising notes that _____ have found evidence of advertising dating back to the 3000s BC, among the Babylonians.
full_sentence: Encarta's History of Advertising notes that archaeologists have found evidence of advertising dating back to the 3000s BC, among the Babylonians.

questions: One of the first known methods of advertising was the outdoor display, usually an _____ sign painted on the wall of a building.
full_sentence: One of the first known methods of advertising was the outdoor display, usually an eye-catching sign painted on the wall of a building.

questions: An outdoor advertisement _____ in Rome offers property for rent, and one found painted on a wall in Pompeii calls the attention of travelers to a tavern.
full_sentence: An outdoor advertisement excavated in Rome offers property for rent, and one found painted on a wall in Pompeii calls the attention of travelers to a tavern.

questions: In medieval times word-of-mouth praise of products gave rise to a simple but effective form of advertising, the use of so-called town _____.
full_sentence: In medieval times word-of-mouth praise of products gave rise to a simple but effective form of advertising, the use of so-called town criers.

questions: These were citizens who read public notices aloud and were also employed by merchants to shout the _____ of their wares.
full_sentence: These were citizens who read public notices aloud and were also employed by merchants to shout the praises of their wares.

questions: Although graphic forms of advertising appeared early in history, printed advertising made little _____ until the invention of the movable-type printing press by German printer Johannes Gutenberg about 1450.
full_sentence: Although graphic forms of advertising appeared early in history, printed advertising made little headway until the invention of the movable-type printing press by German printer Johannes Gutenberg about 1450.

questions: In the United States, the advertising profession began in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in 1841, when Volney B. Palmer _____ up shop as an advertising agent, the forerunner of the advertising agency.
full_sentence: In the United States, the advertising profession began in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in 1841, when Volney B. Palmer set up shop as an advertising agent, the forerunner of the advertising agency.

questions: The introduction of radio created a new opportunity and by the end of the 1920s, advertising had established itself in radio to such a(n) _____ that advertisers were producing many of their own programs.
full_sentence: The introduction of radio created a new opportunity and by the end of the 1920s, advertising had established itself in radio to such a(n) extent that advertisers were producing many of their own programs.

questions: The early 1930s _____ in dozens of radio dramatic series that were known as soap operas because they were sponsored by soap companies.
full_sentence: The early 1930s ushered in dozens of radio dramatic series that were known as soap operas because they were sponsored by soap companies.

questions: Television had been introduced in 1940, but because of the high cost of TV sets and the lack of programming, it was not immediately _____.
full_sentence: Television had been introduced in 1940, but because of the high cost of TV sets and the lack of programming, it was not immediately embraced.

questions: Most accounting positions require a bachelor's degree in accounting or a related field or _____ combination of education and experience.
full_sentence: Most accounting positions require a bachelor's degree in accounting or a related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

questions: Many companies want graduates with a master's degree in accounting, or a master's degree in business administration with _____ in accounting.
full_sentence: Many companies want graduates with a master's degree in accounting, or a master's degree in business administration with a concentration in accounting.

questions: Some schools offer students a chance for hands-on experience with part-time _____ programs in accounting or commercial firms.
full_sentence: Some schools offer students a chance for hands-on experience with part-time internship programs in accounting or commercial firms.

questions: Accountants help make sure that a firm is run efficiently, that its records are maintained accurately, and that its taxes are paid properly and in a _____ manner.
full_sentence: Accountants help make sure that a firm is run efficiently, that its records are maintained accurately, and that its taxes are paid properly and in a timely manner.

questions: Nowadays, accountants are _____ the services they offer with budget analysis, investment planning, and IT consulting.
full_sentence: Nowadays, accountants are broadening the services they offer with budget analysis, investment planning, and IT consulting.

questions: _____ accountants, many of whom are CPAs, generally have their own companies or work for major accounting firms.
full_sentence: Public accountants, many of whom are CPAs, generally have their own companies or work for major accounting firms.

questions: Some accountants specialize in _____ accounting - investigating white-collar crimes such as securities fraud and embezzlement.
full_sentence: Some accountants specialize in forensic accounting - investigating white-collar crimes such as securities fraud and embezzlement.

questions: Many work closely with law enforcement officers and lawyers during investigations and often appear as _____ witnesses during trials.
full_sentence: Many work closely with law enforcement officers and lawyers during investigations and often appear as expert witnesses during trials.

questions: _____ accountants record and analyze the financial information of the firms in which they are employed.
full_sentence: Management accountants record and analyze the financial information of the firms in which they are employed.

questions: Government accountants work in the public _____, maintaining and monitoring the recordkeeping of government departments and agencies.
full_sentence: Government accountants work in the public sector, maintaining and monitoring the recordkeeping of government departments and agencies.

questions: Accounting information systems are a _____ part of an organization's day-to-day operations.
full_sentence: Accounting information systems are a vital part of an organization's day-to-day operations.

questions: Prices can vary from customized multimillion dollar systems to _____ software that costs less than $100.
full_sentence: Prices can vary from customized multimillion dollar systems to prepackaged software that costs less than $100.

questions: Customization allows for a good fit to the business's needs, smooth _____ with other internal systems, and the ability to implement special security measures.
full_sentence: Customization allows for a good fit to the business's needs, smooth interfacing with other internal systems, and the ability to implement special security measures.

questions: Advantages of non-custom software include low cost, immediate availability, quality, documentation on data flow, good compatibility with external systems, and _____ from the vendor.
full_sentence: Advantages of non-custom software include low cost, immediate availability, quality, documentation on data flow, good compatibility with external systems, and support from the vendor.

questions: Disadvantages include lack of features, paying for _____ features, and risk of vendor availability.
full_sentence: Disadvantages include lack of features, paying for unwanted features, and risk of vendor availability.

questions: Good accounting systems allow users to run informal reports such as _____ accounts receivable or to keep track of inventory.
full_sentence: Good accounting systems allow users to run informal reports such as aged accounts receivable or to keep track of inventory.

questions: Accounting systems have to track _____ in three business processes: order entry/sales, billing/accounts receivable/cash receipts, and purchasing/accounts payable/cash.
full_sentence: Accounting systems have to track transactions in three business processes: order entry/sales, billing/accounts receivable/cash receipts, and purchasing/accounts payable/cash.

questions: The order entry/sales process _____ sales data and records the information.
full_sentence: The order entry/sales process captures sales data and records the information.

questions: This process starts with a customer order, which initiates a credit _____.
full_sentence: This process starts with a customer order, which initiates a credit check.

questions: After the customer is approved, the sales order department must let the warehouse know what goods to pick, and the shipping department needs to know that an order has been _____.
full_sentence: After the customer is approved, the sales order department must let the warehouse know what goods to pick, and the shipping department needs to know that an order has been placed.

questions: The Food and Agriculture Organization of the UN advises that an efficient and adequate marketing system is a _____ for agricultural diversification, providing better prices to producers and the availability of competitively priced produce to consumers.
full_sentence: The Food and Agriculture Organization of the UN advises that an efficient and adequate marketing system is a precondition for agricultural diversification, providing better prices to producers and the availability of competitively priced produce to consumers.

questions: Physical improvement is usually addressed in two ways: by providing improved market infrastructure (both urban and rural) and by improving rural _____ roads.
full_sentence: Physical improvement is usually addressed in two ways: by providing improved market infrastructure (both urban and rural) and by improving rural access roads.

questions: Rural markets form part of a trade network; they are normally arranged on a _____ basis on specific weekdays and are commonly organised at a central place in a village or district centre.
full_sentence: Rural markets form part of a trade network; they are normally arranged on a periodic basis on specific weekdays and are commonly organised at a central place in a village or district centre.

questions: Larger rural markets ( assembly markets ) are found where greater quantities of produce are traded, either by the producers themselves or by traders, and are normally situated on main highways, or near to ferries and other local transport _____.
full_sentence: Larger rural markets ( assembly markets ) are found where greater quantities of produce are traded, either by the producers themselves or by traders, and are normally situated on main highways, or near to ferries and other local transport nodes.

questions: _____ wholesale and semi-wholesale markets are located within or near major cities (usually with populations exceeding 0.5 million).
full_sentence: Terminal wholesale and semi-wholesale markets are located within or near major cities (usually with populations exceeding 0.5 million).

questions: Retail markets directly serve consumers in main urban areas; although primarily retail, they may have some semi-wholesale functions, particularly if they allow producers to trade - in which case, they are often called _____ markets.
full_sentence: Retail markets directly serve consumers in main urban areas; although primarily retail, they may have some semi-wholesale functions, particularly if they allow producers to trade - in which case, they are often called farmers' markets.

questions: Internal factors for change include increasing volumes of produce to be handled; alterations to commercial practices and trading patterns; and the _____ of professional specialised wholesalers.
full_sentence: Internal factors for change include increasing volumes of produce to be handled; alterations to commercial practices and trading patterns; and the emergence of professional specialised wholesalers.

questions: The main external causes for change are _____ factors, including increase in population of a city as a result of migration and natural growth, population shifts within cities and moves to the suburbs, and changes in the location and nature of workplaces.
full_sentence: The main external causes for change are demographic factors, including increase in population of a city as a result of migration and natural growth, population shifts within cities and moves to the suburbs, and changes in the location and nature of workplaces.

questions: A common problem at both wholesale and retail levels is that the markets are viewed as tax _____ rather than as means of facilitating the marketing of local produce: the marketing system is 'kidnapped' by municipalities, with the sole purpose of collecting taxes.
full_sentence: A common problem at both wholesale and retail levels is that the markets are viewed as tax instruments rather than as means of facilitating the marketing of local produce: the marketing system is 'kidnapped' by municipalities, with the sole purpose of collecting taxes.

questions: These factors all need to be taken into _____ in identifying the best approach to market development.
full_sentence: These factors all need to be taken into account in identifying the best approach to market development.

questions: Our annual report was _____ to the shareholders on 31 March.
full_sentence: Our annual report was submitted to the shareholders on 31 March.

questions: Turnover remained constant through the _____ year.
full_sentence: Turnover remained constant through the fiscal year.

questions: Profits declined sharply with the devaluation of the _____.
full_sentence: Profits declined sharply with the devaluation of the currency.

questions: Sales fell gradually in the first two quarters, but _____ in the second half of the year.
full_sentence: Sales fell gradually in the first two quarters, but recovered in the second half of the year.

questions: Costs reached _____ in April.
full_sentence: Costs reached a peak in April.

questions: Demand rose sharply after our major competitor went into _____.
full_sentence: Demand rose sharply after our major competitor went into bankruptcy.

questions: Overhead levelled off when utility charges were _____ by the government.
full_sentence: Overhead levelled off when utility charges were frozen by the government.

questions: Prices were raised with the introduction of our new _____ of widgets.
full_sentence: Prices were raised with the introduction of our new line of widgets.

questions: Output _____ up with demand.
full_sentence: Output kept up with demand.

questions: Although the company's overall _____ was weak, its bottom line was still in the black.
full_sentence: Although the company's overall performance was weak, its bottom line was still in the black.

questions: Cathy Smart and the investment analysts at 401k Forum help you get down to the _____ with this article about the different asset classes.
full_sentence: Cathy Smart and the investment analysts at 401k Forum help you get down to the basics with this article about the different asset classes.

questions: Asset classes are the categories that your different investments _____ into - such as cash, bonds, large-cap stocks, small-cap stocks, and international stocks.
full_sentence: Asset classes are the categories that your different investments fall into - such as cash, bonds, large-cap stocks, small-cap stocks, and international stocks.

questions: Studies have shown that the key to successful investing is to _____ your wealth among different asset classes.
full_sentence: Studies have shown that the key to successful investing is to spread your wealth among different asset classes.

questions: Market capitalization (market cap) is a measure of the size and value of a company; to determine this, you simply multiply the number of the company's _____ shares of stock by the market price of one share.
full_sentence: Market capitalization (market cap) is a measure of the size and value of a company; to determine this, you simply multiply the number of the company's outstanding shares of stock by the market price of one share.

questions: Market capitalization is important because history has shown us that the stocks of companies with different market caps _____ differently in terms of return and risk.
full_sentence: Market capitalization is important because history has shown us that the stocks of companies with different market caps behave differently in terms of return and risk.

questions: Cap-size shift: mid-cap stocks may have once been defined as large cap, but fell out of _____ with investors.
full_sentence: Cap-size shift: mid-cap stocks may have once been defined as large cap, but fell out of favor with investors.

questions: Mid-cap stock performance usually falls somewhere in between the returns of their large- and small-cap _____.
full_sentence: Mid-cap stock performance usually falls somewhere in between the returns of their large- and small-cap counterparts.

questions: However, mid- and small-cap stock returns tend to be more _____ than the returns of large-cap stocks.
full_sentence: However, mid- and small-cap stock returns tend to be more volatile than the returns of large-cap stocks.

questions: If a smaller company loses a few key executives, or if the economy takes a _____ for the worse, it only takes a few nervous investors to cause the stock to drop drastically.
full_sentence: If a smaller company loses a few key executives, or if the economy takes a turn for the worse, it only takes a few nervous investors to cause the stock to drop drastically.

questions: _____ can reduce your risk and help protect your investment: if one asset class in your portfolio is performing poorly, there's a chance that another asset class within your portfolio will be performing well.
full_sentence: Diversification can reduce your risk and help protect your investment: if one asset class in your portfolio is performing poorly, there's a chance that another asset class within your portfolio will be performing well.

questions: The purpose of an audit is to gather and evaluate evidence in order to form an opinion on the _____ of a company's financial statements.
full_sentence: The purpose of an audit is to gather and evaluate evidence in order to form an opinion on the reliability of a company's financial statements.

questions: The audit _____ is usually no more than a page in length and is attached to the financial statements.
full_sentence: The audit report is usually no more than a page in length and is attached to the financial statements.

questions: Auditors are not responsible for the _____ of the financial statements of an company.
full_sentence: Auditors are not responsible for the preparation of the financial statements of an company.

questions: In the financial statements, the company implicitly states that all items, account balances and transactions are _____ valid, complete and accurate.
full_sentence: In the financial statements, the company implicitly states that all items, account balances and transactions are materially valid, complete and accurate.

questions: An error in _____ is committed when the financial statements include an item that should not be included.
full_sentence: An error in validity is committed when the financial statements include an item that should not be included.

questions: An error in _____ is committed when the financial statements do not include an item which should be included.
full_sentence: An error in completeness is committed when the financial statements do not include an item which should be included.

questions: An error in _____ is committed when the financial statements include incorrect information about an item that should be included.
full_sentence: An error in accuracy is committed when the financial statements include incorrect information about an item that should be included.

questions: One of the principal goals of the auditor is to add _____ to this assertion.
full_sentence: One of the principal goals of the auditor is to add credibility to this assertion.

questions: Audit risk is the risk that the auditor expresses an inappropriate audit opinion when the financial statements are significantly _____.
full_sentence: Audit risk is the risk that the auditor expresses an inappropriate audit opinion when the financial statements are significantly misstated.

questions: In addition to the financial statements, the auditor also examines the company's internal _____ procedures for effectiveness.
full_sentence: In addition to the financial statements, the auditor also examines the company's internal control procedures for effectiveness.

questions: LeaseGuide.com author Al Hearn explains that automobile leasing is based entirely on the _____ that you pay for the amount by which a vehicle's value depreciates during the time you're driving it.
full_sentence: LeaseGuide.com author Al Hearn explains that automobile leasing is based entirely on the concept that you pay for the amount by which a vehicle's value depreciates during the time you're driving it.

questions: Depreciation is the difference between a vehicle's original value and its value at lease-end (_____ value), and is the primary factor that determines the cost of leasing.
full_sentence: Depreciation is the difference between a vehicle's original value and its value at lease-end (residual value), and is the primary factor that determines the cost of leasing.

questions: Generally, European and Japanese automobile _____ have lower depreciation than American brands.
full_sentence: Generally, European and Japanese automobile makes have lower depreciation than American brands.

questions: Manufacturer's _____ Retail Price (MSRP) is the full price for a vehicle as displayed on its window sticker, including optional packages and destination charges.
full_sentence: Manufacturer's Suggested Retail Price (MSRP) is the full price for a vehicle as displayed on its window sticker, including optional packages and destination charges.

questions: When you and your dealer sit down and agree on a lease price for a car, this becomes the _____ cost, or "cap cost".
full_sentence: When you and your dealer sit down and agree on a lease price for a car, this becomes the capitalized cost, or "cap cost".

questions: Cap cost can be reduced by rebates, factory-to-dealer incentives, trade-in credit, or a cash _____ payment; these are known as cap cost reductions.
full_sentence: Cap cost can be reduced by rebates, factory-to-dealer incentives, trade-in credit, or a cash down payment; these are known as cap cost reductions.

questions: When you lease, you're _____ the leasing company's money while you're driving their car and they rightfully expect you to pay interest on that money, the same as with a loan.
full_sentence: When you lease, you're tying up the leasing company's money while you're driving their car and they rightfully expect you to pay interest on that money, the same as with a loan.

questions: This interest is expressed as a money factor, sometimes called lease factor, and is specified as a small _____ number such as.00297.
full_sentence: This interest is expressed as a money factor, sometimes called lease factor, and is specified as a small decimal number such as.00297.

questions: A good rule of _____: Lease money factors, converted to an annual interest rate, should be comparable to, if not lower than local new-car loan interest rates.
full_sentence: A good rule of thumb: Lease money factors, converted to an annual interest rate, should be comparable to, if not lower than local new-car loan interest rates.

questions: However, you may not qualify for great money factors unless if you have _____ credit rating.
full_sentence: However, you may not qualify for great money factors unless if you have a spotless credit rating.

questions: Electronics is the study and utilization of systems that function by guiding electron flow in _____ such as semiconductors.
full_sentence: Electronics is the study and utilization of systems that function by guiding electron flow in devices such as semiconductors.

questions: Designing and building electronic circuits to solve _____ problems is the mandate of electronics engineering.
full_sentence: Designing and building electronic circuits to solve practical problems is the mandate of electronics engineering.

questions: Research into innovative semiconductor technology and applications is considered a _____ of physics.
full_sentence: Research into innovative semiconductor technology and applications is considered a branch of physics.

questions: Electronic circuits are mainly used to control, process and distribute information, and for the _____ and distribution of electric power.
full_sentence: Electronic circuits are mainly used to control, process and distribute information, and for the conversion and distribution of electric power.

questions: These two purposes rely on the creation and detection of electromagnetic _____ and electrical currents.
full_sentence: These two purposes rely on the creation and detection of electromagnetic fields and electrical currents.

questions: The rapid modern advancement of electronics began in _____ with the introduction of the radio.
full_sentence: The rapid modern advancement of electronics began in earnest with the introduction of the radio.

questions: There are three divisions to an electronics system, an example of which is a television _____.
full_sentence: There are three divisions to an electronics system, an example of which is a television set.

questions: First, the input is a broadcast signal either received by its antenna or _____ in through a cable.
full_sentence: First, the input is a broadcast signal either received by its antenna or fed in through a cable.

questions: Second, processing circuits inside the TV _____ the brightness, colour and audio data from this signal.
full_sentence: Second, processing circuits inside the TV extract the brightness, colour and audio data from this signal.

questions: Third and last, its output apparatus, a cathode ray tube, changes the electronic signals into a _____ image on its screen.
full_sentence: Third and last, its output apparatus, a cathode ray tube, changes the electronic signals into a visible image on its screen.

questions: Common shareholders have the right to elect directors, to vote on certain corporate matters, and to share in any _____ assets of the company if it is wound up.
full_sentence: Common shareholders have the right to elect directors, to vote on certain corporate matters, and to share in any residual assets of the company if it is wound up.

questions: Common shareholders are the last to claim assets in cases of _____.
full_sentence: Common shareholders are the last to claim assets in cases of insolvency.

questions: Preferred shareholders may have no voting rights, but special features on redemption or _____ of preferred shares into common shares exist in many cases.
full_sentence: Preferred shareholders may have no voting rights, but special features on redemption or conversion of preferred shares into common shares exist in many cases.

questions: U.S. Savings Bonds are backed by the general credit and taxation powers of the federal government, so there is virtually no risk of _____.
