questions: The teacher saw, out of the corner of his eye, someone _____ pass a note to someone else.
full_sentence: The teacher saw, out of the corner of his eye, someone trying to pass a note to someone else.

questions: If the package must be received by tomorrow you can have it _____ through an overnight express courier.
full_sentence: If the package must be received by tomorrow you can have it delivered through an overnight express courier.

questions: The people in general looked upon the situation _____.
full_sentence: The people in general looked upon the situation as critical.

questions: "What kind of suit did you buy?" "Well, I think it's somewhat _____ yours."
full_sentence: "What kind of suit did you buy?" "Well, I think it's somewhat like yours."

questions: It's still not _____ that the meeting will go ahead as planed.
full_sentence: It's still not certain	 that the meeting will go ahead as planed.

questions: It is easy _____ along with her.
full_sentence: It is easy for them to get along with her.

questions: Your father likes to play golf. He's really enthusiastic _____ it.
full_sentence: Your father likes to play golf. He's really enthusiastic about it.

questions: "Is Paul your brother?" "No, but he is related _____ me."
full_sentence: "Is Paul your brother?" "No, but he is related to me."

questions: "Will we be able to visit the White House?" "Sure. It's open _____ every morning."
full_sentence: "Will we be able to visit the White House?" "Sure. It's open to the public every morning."

questions: Your face is very _____ me.
full_sentence: Your face is very familiar to me.

questions: Understanding the cultural habits of another nation is a complex, bewildering task, but the rewards of knowing at least the fundamentals of the way of life are _____ the time and trouble it takes to learn them.
full_sentence: Understanding the cultural habits of another nation is a complex, bewildering task, but the rewards of knowing at least the fundamentals of the way of life are well worth the time and trouble it takes to learn them.

questions: When I entered the police station, a policeman said, " _____ your husband has been arrested."
full_sentence: When I entered the police station, a policeman said, " I am sorry your husband has been arrested."

questions: I don't think that your coat is _____.
full_sentence: I don't think that your coat is worth the price.

questions: I was nearly stone-broke then; I had to keep body and soul together somehow with the greatest difficulty _____.
full_sentence: I was nearly stone-broke then; I had to keep body and soul together somehow with the greatest difficulty imaginable.

questions: The history teacher said that the _____ middle ages were quite unlike those of fiction.
full_sentence: The history teacher said that the historical middle ages were quite unlike those of fiction.

questions: Most great artists are exceptionally _____ people.
full_sentence: Most great artists are exceptionally sensitive people.

questions: Without any previous knowledge of environmental law, Mr. Matthews can _____ answer a technical question like yours.
full_sentence: Without any previous knowledge of environmental law, Mr. Matthews can hardly be expected to answer a technical question like yours.

questions: Although it had been explained to him several times, he _____ could not see what the problem was.
full_sentence: Although it had been explained to him several times, he still could not see what the problem was.

questions: The metal workers of England and America kept searching for a formula that would enable cost-effective steel production. It is not to be wondered, _____, that a method of making huge batches of good steel was found in both countries, almost simultaneously.
full_sentence: The metal workers of England and America kept searching for a formula that would enable cost-effective steel production. It is not to be wondered, therefore, that a method of making huge batches of good steel was found in both countries, almost simultaneously.

questions: The marines attacked the south beach at daybreak; _____, as a diversionary maneuver, a company landed on the north side of the island.
full_sentence: The marines attacked the south beach at daybreak; simultaneously, as a diversionary maneuver, a company landed on the north side of the island.

questions: Smith probably committed the crime. He had a guilty look on his face. _____, 	the police found a gun under his bed.
full_sentence: Smith probably committed the crime. He had a guilty look on his face. Moreover, 	the police found a gun under his bed.

questions: The gun was under the bed; Smith had a guilty look on his face; _____, it is likely that Smith committed the crime.
full_sentence: The gun was under the bed; Smith had a guilty look on his face; therefore, it is likely that Smith committed the crime.

questions: Jody looked _____ at the towering mountains--ridge after ridge until at last there was the ocean.
full_sentence: Jody looked searchingly at the towering mountains--ridge after ridge until at last there was the ocean.

questions: Using computer programs, the police are able to project what the missing boy will look like two years _____.
full_sentence: Using computer programs, the police are able to project what the missing boy will look like two years from now.

questions: Recently there have been many changes in the city's scene, but _____ the most dramatic change has been the arrival of skyscrapers.
full_sentence: Recently there have been many changes in the city's scene, but by far the most dramatic change has been the arrival of skyscrapers.

questions: Her husband, a plumber's assistant, earns only $300 a month, which makes it very difficult for her to feed and clothe her children properly, _____ send them to school.
full_sentence: Her husband, a plumber's assistant, earns only $300 a month, which makes it very difficult for her to feed and clothe her children properly, much less	 send them to school.

questions: Most wildlife conservationists believe it is just as important to keep some wildlife from becoming too plentiful _____ to keep others from becoming too scarce.
full_sentence: Most wildlife conservationists believe it is just as important to keep some wildlife from becoming too plentiful as it is to keep others from becoming too scarce.

questions: In a personal computer, the greater _____ microprocessor's speed the more expensive it usually is.
full_sentence: In a personal computer, the greater of the microprocessor's speed the more expensive it usually is.

questions: The Japanese fox is probably the most cunning animal _____ is.
full_sentence: The Japanese fox is probably the most cunning animal that is.

questions: Korean students are not encouraged to analyze things, _____ to think on their own.
full_sentence: Korean students are not encouraged to analyze things, and are not to think on their own.

questions: He was found guilty of using abusive language, but instead of being rejected by his supporters he was all _____ highly regarded.
full_sentence: He was found guilty of using abusive language, but instead of being rejected by his supporters he was all as highly regarded.

questions: Exercising is _____ as any to lose unwanted weight.
full_sentence: Exercising is as good a way as any to lose unwanted weight.

questions: "What do you think about Edward?" "He's smarter than _____ in his class."
full_sentence: "What do you think about Edward?" "He's smarter than any other ones in his class."

questions: Michael Jackson's album "Thriller" was the most successful album _____ recorded in terms of sales.
full_sentence: Michael Jackson's album "Thriller" was the most successful album being recorded in terms of sales.

questions: "When will he come back?" "He will be back _____."
full_sentence: "When will he come back?" "He will be back in next Sunday."

questions: Mary Ann Hardy spent most of her life _____ miniature watercolor portraits on ivory.
full_sentence: Mary Ann Hardy spent most of her life in painting on miniature watercolor portraits on ivory.

questions: The increase _____ students applying early results from the same demographic bulge that has made getting tougher and tougher.
full_sentence: The increase for students applying early results from the same demographic bulge that has made getting tougher and tougher.

questions: We're going to celebrate tonight. We have decided to take them out for dinner to a fancy restaurant and then go _____ to a show.
full_sentence: We're going to celebrate tonight. We have decided to take them out for dinner to a fancy restaurant and then go on to a show.

questions: The human infant differs from the young of other mammals, such as the rodents and carnivores, which _____ few exceptions are functionally blind and deaf at birth.
full_sentence: The human infant differs from the young of other mammals, such as the rodents and carnivores, which only few exceptions are functionally blind and deaf at birth.

questions: "Why do you hate him?" "I'm sick of his bossing us _____ like that. Who does he think he is?"
full_sentence: "Why do you hate him?" "I'm sick of his bossing us in like that. Who does he think he is?"

questions: Doctoral students who are preparing to take their qualifying examinations have been studying in the library every night _____ the last three months.
full_sentence: Doctoral students who are preparing to take their qualifying examinations have been studying in the library every night for the last three months.

questions: There is nothing like education for bringing _____ light the essential inequality between one mind and another.
full_sentence: There is nothing like education for bringing ver light the essential inequality between one mind and another.

questions: The new scientific hypotheses being proposed now will be substantiated or disproven _____ time.
full_sentence: The new scientific hypotheses being proposed now will be substantiated or disproven at time.

questions: Environmental pollution is one of the most serious problems that confront not only Korea but the world _____ large.
full_sentence: Environmental pollution is one of the most serious problems that confront not only Korea but the world at large.

questions: These articles are not much _____ demand now.
full_sentence: These articles are not much in demand now.

questions: On July 8, 1853, Commodore Matthew Perry sailed his black-hulled steam frigate into Edo Bay and "opened" Japan _____ gunpoint.
full_sentence: On July 8, 1853, Commodore Matthew Perry sailed his black-hulled steam frigate into Edo Bay and "opened" Japan at gunpoint.

questions: There are various problems the solution _____ is helpless.
full_sentence: There are various problems the solution to which is helpless.

questions: "Where does he live?" "He lives _____ 144 Wall Street."
full_sentence: "Where does he live?" "He lives at 144 Wall Street."

questions: "Where does happiness come from?" "Happiness lies _____ trying to do one's duty."
full_sentence: "Where does happiness come from?" "Happiness lies in trying to do one's duty."

questions: It is basic to examine your values and make sure you are devoting the bulk of your energy _____ things you really care about.
full_sentence: It is basic to examine your values and make sure you are devoting the bulk of your energy to things you really care about.

questions: To meet someone unexpectedly is to run _____ him.
full_sentence: To meet someone unexpectedly is to run into him.

questions: I have never had much patience with the writers who claim _____ the reader an effort to understand their meaning.
full_sentence: I have never had much patience with the writers who claim from the reader an effort to understand their meaning.

questions: Heather was born in Lima _____ August 7, 1966.
full_sentence: Heather was born in Lima on August 7, 1966.

questions: If you are physically attacked and wounded by a burglar, you will be permitted to retaliate _____ him the injury he caused you physically as well as emotionally.
full_sentence: If you are physically attacked and wounded by a burglar, you will be permitted to retaliate on him the injury he caused you physically as well as emotionally.

questions: "Why didn't Kim join in the game?" "He thinks he's _____ the rest of us."
full_sentence: "Why didn't Kim join in the game?" "He thinks he's above the rest of us."

questions: Never before was it possible for one nation to make war on another without sending armies _____ borders.
full_sentence: Never before was it possible for one nation to make war on another without sending armies across borders.

questions: It makes me mad to see talent being wasted _____ chasing after the shallow of the latest rave gathering.
full_sentence: It makes me mad to see talent being wasted on chasing after the shallow of the latest rave gathering.

questions: He was riding _____ the crowded street.
full_sentence: He was riding through the crowded street.

questions: The hope of the world is in exalting man's humanity _____ anything that might divide men from each other.
full_sentence: The hope of the world is in exalting man's humanity above anything that might divide men from each other.

questions: He may be sorry but that won't make _____ the damage he has done.
full_sentence: He may be sorry but that won't make up for the damage he has done.

questions: The welfare reform bill was segmented and then divided _____ three different subcommittees of the Congress.
full_sentence: The welfare reform bill was segmented and then divided among three different subcommittees of the Congress.

questions: Reading _____ she knew there is something wrong.
full_sentence: Reading between the lines she knew there is something wrong.

questions: Science searches for relations which are thought to exist independently _____ the searching individual.
full_sentence: Science searches for relations which are thought to exist independently of the searching individual.

questions: The international food fair offers culinary delights from around the world free _____ charge.
full_sentence: The international food fair offers culinary delights from around the world free of charge.

questions: Hawk serve an important purpose in the scheme of nature _____ on destructive rodents, such as mice and rats.
full_sentence: Hawk serve an important purpose in the scheme of nature by preying on destructive rodents, such as mice and rats.

questions: James Baker _____ math throughout his college life.
full_sentence: James Baker was bored with math throughout his college life.

questions: His overall strength has waned _____ the spread of cancer through his body.
full_sentence: His overall strength has waned over the spread of cancer through his body.

questions: He went pale _____ the news.
full_sentence: He went pale at the news.

questions: _____ my surprise, I found him sitting by himself in the corner.
full_sentence: To my surprise, I found him sitting by himself in the corner.

questions: The doctor expressed strongly that he hoped _____ her recovery.
full_sentence: The doctor expressed strongly that he hoped for her recovery.

questions: His effort to incite Calabria to insurrection resulted _____ failure, so Michele Pezza was executed in Naples in 1806.
full_sentence: His effort to incite Calabria to insurrection resulted in failure, so Michele Pezza was executed in Naples in 1806.

questions: If you take her _____ pieces, you can call her young, brilliant, extremely modern, exquisitely well dressed.
full_sentence: If you take her to pieces, you can call her young, brilliant, extremely modern, exquisitely well dressed.

questions: Their policy does not stand up _____ scrutiny.
full_sentence: Their policy does not stand up under scrutiny.

questions: In the church she was praying alone, _____ tears streaming down her face.
full_sentence: In the church she was praying alone, with tears streaming down her face.

questions: The heart-lung machine rids the blood of carbon dioxide and replenishes it _____ oxygen.
full_sentence: The heart-lung machine rids the blood of carbon dioxide and replenishes it with oxygen.

questions: They feel it dangerous not to conform _____ the rules of the group.
full_sentence: They feel it dangerous not to conform to the rules of the group.

questions: We have approached a period when there is a real chance of excluding war once and _____ from the life of society.
full_sentence: We have approached a period when there is a real chance of excluding war once and for all from the life of society.

questions: I subscribe _____ Life, Time and the New Yorker.
full_sentence: I subscribe to Life, Time and the New Yorker.

questions: On behalf _____ his client, the lawyer entered a plea of "not guilty by reason of insanity."
full_sentence: On behalf of his client, the lawyer entered a plea of "not guilty by reason of insanity."

questions: Professor Mary of my university usually arrives on campus _____ to have a glass of milk before her first lecture.
full_sentence: Professor Mary of my university usually arrives on campus in time to have a glass of milk before her first lecture.

questions: They have met many people _____ the two years they have been in London.
full_sentence: They have met many people for the two years they have been in London.

questions: We discussed the matter _____ lunch.
full_sentence: We discussed the matter over lunch.

questions: Miriam didn't go to the movies last night because she was so busy _____ for her trip to Guam.
full_sentence: Miriam didn't go to the movies last night because she was so busy preparing for her trip to Guam.

questions: Taekwondo is _____ one of the most popular forms of Eastern exercise in the West these days.
full_sentence: Taekwondo is referred to as one of the most popular forms of Eastern exercise in the West these days.

questions: It was agreed that during the period the prisoner _____ the right to see visiting people and to receive letters and newspapers.
full_sentence: It was agreed that during the period the prisoner would be deprived of the right to see visiting people and to receive letters and newspapers.

questions: Unfortunately he died after ten years of struggle against a disease. He is _____ by his wife and two sons.
full_sentence: Unfortunately he died after ten years of struggle against a disease. He is survived by his wife and two sons.

questions: The need for the Korean economy to gain ground on the world market on a stable basis _____ more acutely now than ever before.
full_sentence: The need for the Korean economy to gain ground on the world market on a stable basis is being felt more acutely now than ever before.

questions: The scientific study of the motion of bodies and the action of forces that change or cause motion _____ dynamics.
full_sentence: The scientific study of the motion of bodies and the action of forces that change or cause motion is called dynamics.

questions: "Your daughter has two children, doesn't she?" "That's right. She _____ in 1970."
full_sentence: "Your daughter has two children, doesn't she?" "That's right. She got married in 1970."

questions: He _____ to eat a ham sandwich.
full_sentence: He has decided to eat a ham sandwich.

questions: "Can you advise me to buy a car?" "I advise you _____ the secondhand car."
full_sentence: "Can you advise me to buy a car?" "I advise you not to purchase the secondhand car."

questions: Your shoes need _____.
full_sentence: Your shoes need polishing	.

questions: I tried _____ some aspirin, but I couldn't get the cap off the bottle.
full_sentence: I tried taking some aspirin, but I couldn't get the cap off the bottle.

questions: It's very stupid _____ to do such a thing.
full_sentence: It's very stupid of you to do such a thing.

questions: It makes me mad to see the talent being wasted on chasing _____ the shallowness of the latest rave gathering.
full_sentence: It makes me mad to see the talent being wasted on chasing after the shallowness of the latest rave gathering.

questions: She ordered the room _____.
full_sentence: She ordered the room to be cleaned by ten.

questions: It's becoming more important for us to know _____ a computer.
full_sentence: It's becoming more important for us to know how to use a computer.

questions: Pragmatists were hardly the first men _____ that beliefs control behavior.
full_sentence: Pragmatists were hardly the first men to insist that beliefs control behavior.

questions: With her highly acclaimed little saint Rao, Uma Subramanium became the first Indian woman _____ a play in a major American theater.
full_sentence: With her highly acclaimed little saint Rao, Uma Subramanium became the first Indian woman to stage a play in a major American theater.

questions: This error leads to the assumption that there is nothing _____ about love.
full_sentence: This error leads to the assumption that there is nothing to be learned about love.

questions: _____ a state to survive more than a fleeting historical moment, it must have the loyalty of its residents.
full_sentence: For a state to survive more than a fleeting historical moment, it must have the loyalty of its residents.

questions: I am satisfied with my position in life. I have no patience with my colleagues who complain that the disadvantages of their job outweigh the advantages. From personal experience, I have learned _____.
full_sentence: I am satisfied with my position in life. I have no patience with my colleagues who complain that the disadvantages of their job outweigh the advantages. From personal experience, I have learned never to complain.

questions: The company of poets may enable the men who tend the machines _____ a large panorama of possibilities.
full_sentence: The company of poets may enable the men who tend the machines to see a large panorama of possibilities.

questions: The purpose of this survey is to find out _____ the residents know about the budget of their local government.
full_sentence: The purpose of this survey is to find out how much the residents know about the budget of their local government.

questions: Many astronomers suggest that the Ice Age may have been triggered by the solar system's _____ through a cloud of dust and gas.
full_sentence: Many astronomers suggest that the Ice Age may have been triggered by the solar system's passing through a cloud of dust and gas.

questions: "Why don't you like John?" "I dislike _____ him tell old jokes."
full_sentence: "Why don't you like John?" "I dislike hearing him tell old jokes."

questions: "What did Peggy come here for? "She said she would appreciate _____ you come to her party."
full_sentence: "What did Peggy come here for? "She said she would appreciate having you come to her party."

questions: "What did she talk about?" "She suggested _____ to the movies tonight."
full_sentence: "What did she talk about?" "She suggested going to the movies tonight."

questions: He narrowly escaped _____ by a taxi.
full_sentence: He narrowly escaped being run over by a taxi.

questions: "I never saw you before." "Can you recall _____ me two years ago?"
full_sentence: "I never saw you before." "Can you recall meeting me two years ago?"

questions: "What do you expect me to do?" "The house needs _____."
full_sentence: "What do you expect me to do?" "The house needs painting."

questions: I _____ writing at least one chapter of my new grammar book after work.
full_sentence: I am in the habit of writing at least one chapter of my new grammar book after work.

questions: "May I speak to Mrs. Louis?" "One moment please. I'll _____ to his line."
full_sentence: "May I speak to Mrs. Louis?" "One moment please. I'll transfer you to his line."

questions: Not _____ does calcium build strong bones and teeth, it is also important in the action of muscles.
full_sentence: Not merely does calcium build strong bones and teeth, it is also important in the action of muscles.

questions: While reading a novel is a difficult and demanding job, _____ be capable not only of great fineness of perception, but of great boldness of imagination if you are going to make use of all that the novelist gives you.
full_sentence: While reading a novel is a difficult and demanding job, you must be capable not only of great fineness of perception, but of great boldness of imagination if you are going to make use of all that the novelist gives you.

questions: Though Mr. and Mrs. Smith were in a traffic accident on their way home, they were not seriously injured, _____ suffer any costly damage.
full_sentence: Though Mr. and Mrs. Smith were in a traffic accident on their way home, they were not seriously injured, nor did their car suffer any costly damage.

questions: More than twelve hours of many school week are spent in one of the dingiest _____ most versatile rooms of the Arts Building.
full_sentence: More than twelve hours of many school week are spent in one of the dingiest yet most versatile rooms of the Arts Building.

questions: Emily Carr's travel along the west coast of Canada were very influential in her life, _____ were the inspiration to many of her greatest works of art.
full_sentence: Emily Carr's travel along the west coast of Canada were very influential in her life, for they were the inspiration to many of her greatest works of art.

questions: _____ are the juice and pulp of the grape useful, but various products are made from the skins and seeds.
full_sentence: Not only are the juice and pulp of the grape useful, but various products are made from the skins and seeds.

questions: Although there are so many women in the labor force today, they are still facing many problems. For one thing, women workers do not yet receive equal treatment in the job market, _____ in the area of hiring, or in the area of salary.
full_sentence: Although there are so many women in the labor force today, they are still facing many problems. For one thing, women workers do not yet receive equal treatment in the job market, either in the area of hiring, or in the area of salary.

questions: Novice criticizes the bloating and misuse of the Holocaust in the 1980s and is scathing on _____ calls deeply offensive claims of Holocaust.
full_sentence: Novice criticizes the bloating and misuse of the Holocaust in the 1980s and is scathing on what he calls deeply offensive claims of Holocaust.

questions: _____ an object floats on water depends on the density of both the object and the water.
full_sentence: Whether an object floats on water depends on the density of both the object and the water.

questions: Mrs. Gordon sometimes doubted _____ get on the plane.
full_sentence: Mrs. Gordon sometimes doubted whether they would get on the plane.

questions: The people at the party were worried about Janet because no one was aware _____ she had gone.
full_sentence: The people at the party were worried about Janet because no one was aware of where she had gone.

questions: The reason I didn't go to France was _____ a new job.
full_sentence: The reason I didn't go to France was that I got a new job.

questions: _____ that power is used well or ill depends upon the moral and political intelligence of the world.
full_sentence: Whether that power is used well or ill depends upon the moral and political intelligence of the world.

questions: In his will, Alfred Nobel left specific instructions _____ the winners of the science awards he endowed are to be selected.
full_sentence: In his will, Alfred Nobel left specific instructions as to how the winners of the science awards he endowed are to be selected.

questions: I can't remember where you said the Browns lived. Where _____ the Browns lived?
full_sentence: I can't remember where you said the Browns lived. Where did you say the Browns lived?

questions: She has not the least interest _____ you propose to do.
full_sentence: She has not the least interest in which you propose to do.

questions: A man could draw a picture on the wall of his cave to show _____ direction he had gone or what prey he hoped to catch.
full_sentence: A man could draw a picture on the wall of his cave to show in which direction he had gone or what prey he hoped to catch.

questions: Liberal education should hold before the rising generation _____ Whitehead has called the habitual vision of greatness.
full_sentence: Liberal education should hold before the rising generation what Whitehead has called the habitual vision of greatness.

questions: The behavior of gases is explained by _____ the kinetic theory.
full_sentence: The behavior of gases is explained by what scientists call the kinetic theory.

questions: Reading is to the mind _____ exercise is to the body.
full_sentence: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.

questions: "What do you think about John?" "He has no sense _____."
full_sentence: "What do you think about John?" "He has no sense whatsoever."

questions: "How does your stove work?" "This button is _____ turns it on."
full_sentence: "How does your stove work?" "This button is what turns it on."

questions: _____ chiefly lies behind slang is simply a kind of linguistic exuberance, an excess of word-making energy.
full_sentence: What chiefly lies behind slang is simply a kind of linguistic exuberance, an excess of word-making energy.

questions: We are beginning to form an estimate of the world's ecological condition _____ in some ways even more disturbing than the environmental bad news of 20 or 30 years ago.
full_sentence: We are beginning to form an estimate of the world's ecological condition that is in some ways even more disturbing than the environmental bad news of 20 or 30 years ago.

questions: But we _____ live as minorities in a multicultural setting are forced to ask ourselves the fundamental questions.
full_sentence: But we who live as minorities in a multicultural setting are forced to ask ourselves the fundamental questions.

questions: Major League baseball season begins early in April and ends in October, _____ each team plays one hundred and more games.
full_sentence: Major League baseball season begins early in April and ends in October, during which each team plays one hundred and more games.

questions: Engineering is a field of study _____ a lot of dedication and commitment is required.
full_sentence: Engineering is a field of study where a lot of dedication and commitment is required.

questions: The group camped _____ people had camped previously.
full_sentence: The group camped where people had camped previously.

questions: "What do you think about the boy?" "The boy _____ I believed to be honest deceived me."
full_sentence: "What do you think about the boy?" "The boy whom I believed to be honest deceived me."

questions: Try to put yourselves in the other people's place and to see why they hold the opinions or do the things _____ you strongly disagree.
full_sentence: Try to put yourselves in the other people's place and to see why they hold the opinions or do the things with which you strongly disagree.

questions: The Orion constellation is usually identified by "Orion Belt", 3 stars _____ create a straight line.
full_sentence: The Orion constellation is usually identified by "Orion Belt", 3 stars which create a straight line.

questions: "Then, how about Tolstoy's great novels?" "Who _____ has read his great novels can forget their fascination?"
full_sentence: "Then, how about Tolstoy's great novels?" "Who that has read his great novels can forget their fascination?"

questions: Habits are easily formed: especially such as are bad; and _____ today seems to be a small affair will soon become fixed, and hold you with the strength of a cable.
full_sentence: Habits are easily formed: especially such as are bad; and what today seems to be a small affair will soon become fixed, and hold you with the strength of a cable.

questions: _____ he may have done, I shall stand by him.
full_sentence: Whatever he may have done, I shall stand by him.

questions: It won't be profitable to exploit the sea, no matter _____ great riches it has.
full_sentence: It won't be profitable to exploit the sea, no matter how great riches it has.

questions: I was barely ten years old _____ my dad gave me the responsibility of feeding the turkeys and cleaning out the barns.
full_sentence: I was barely ten years old when my dad gave me the responsibility of feeding the turkeys and cleaning out the barns.

questions: Let's keep the heating on _____ the temperatures drop below zero overnight.
full_sentence: Let's keep the heating on in case the temperatures drop below zero overnight.

questions: Shall I put this equipment away _____ you've finished the lab work?
full_sentence: Shall I put this equipment away now that you've finished the lab work?

questions: "The food at the new restaurant is delicious." "It's expensive _____."
full_sentence: "The food at the new restaurant is delicious." "It's expensive though."

questions: Your experience there cannot be valuable, _____ you don't speak the language.
full_sentence: Your experience there cannot be valuable, inasmuch as you don't speak the language.

questions: _____ the two government leaders could not reach an agreement, the possibilities for peace are still remote.
full_sentence: Inasmuch as the two government leaders could not reach an agreement, the possibilities for peace are still remote.

questions: Conversation is unlike a discussion _____ one is not trying to arrive at any definite conclusion.
full_sentence: Conversation is unlike a discussion insofar as one is not trying to arrive at any definite conclusion.

questions: You should learn to change a tire on your car _____ you can handle an emergency situation if necessary.
full_sentence: You should learn to change a tire on your car so that you can handle an emergency situation if necessary.

questions: You'd better put the ice cream in the freezer so that it _____.
full_sentence: You'd better put the ice cream in the freezer so that it won't melt.

questions: Newton reasoned, _____ had Kepler, that there must be some attractive force operating between the bodies of the solar system.
full_sentence: Newton reasoned, as had Kepler, that there must be some attractive force operating between the bodies of the solar system.

questions: The court presumed Smith innocent _____ he was proven guilty.
full_sentence: The court presumed Smith innocent until he was proven guilty.

questions: _____ a baby turtle is hatched, it must be able to fend for itself.
full_sentence: As soon as a baby turtle is hatched, it must be able to fend for itself.

questions: A good many years of study and experiment will be necessary _____ anything very definite can be said on this subject.
full_sentence: A good many years of study and experiment will be necessary before anything very definite can be said on this subject.

questions: "Be proud of what you do," my father always told me, " _____ you're boss or mopping floors."
full_sentence: "Be proud of what you do," my father always told me, " whether you're boss or mopping floors."

questions: I would have rung you up, but I _____ your telephone number then.
full_sentence: I would have rung you up, but I did not know your telephone number then.

questions: If they had no notion of what we mean by right, we _____ them for that.
full_sentence: If they had no notion of what we mean by right, we could blame them for that.

questions: We didn't study French last night, but we _____.

questions: I readily forgive the prejudice which leads my friend to wrong conclusions because I understand it. It is a minor error into which I myself, _____ the grace of some happy chance, might have fallen.

questions: _____, leisure promotes health, efficiency, and happiness.

questions: Imparting information may increase the store of factual knowledge, but it does not develop the intellect to the same extent as _____ active attack on a problem.

questions: Despite the trend for fancy homes, the architect built a _____ one for himself.
full_sentence: Despite the trend for fancy homes, the architect built a simple one for himself.

questions: The stock market has a history of growth in the long run and _____ in the short run.
full_sentence: The stock market has a history of growth in the long run and volatility in the short run.

questions: You can be certain _____ we remain committed to providing outstanding customer service.
full_sentence: You can be certain that we remain committed to providing outstanding customer service.

questions: Laser printers typically _____ single sheets of letter-sized paper.
full_sentence: Laser printers typically handle single sheets of letter-sized paper.

questions: The people seated in the back of the room could hardly _____ the speaker.
full_sentence: The people seated in the back of the room could hardly hear the speaker.

questions: Marge spent the whole summer _____ in summer school.
full_sentence: Marge spent the whole summer studying in summer school.

questions: Mr. Weaton accidentally left his keys _____ the lock and then couldn't find them.
full_sentence: Mr. Weaton accidentally left his keys in the lock and then couldn't find them.

questions: Joe will have a suit _____ by the tailor I recommended to him.
full_sentence: Joe will have a suit made by the tailor I recommended to him.

questions: Peg is rich but her sister is _____ she is.
full_sentence: Peg is rich but her sister is even richer than she is.

questions: She didn't want to give the speech but eventually _____ to do it.
full_sentence: She didn't want to give the speech but eventually consented to do it.

questions: Mrs. Allen couldn't read the small print on the document very well so she used a _____ glass.
full_sentence: Mrs. Allen couldn't read the small print on the document very well so she used a magnifying glass.

questions: _____ his trip to Australia, Ben visited Ayer's Rock.
full_sentence: During his trip to Australia, Ben visited Ayer's Rock.

questions: Mary liked the dresses at the store, so she decided to _____.
full_sentence: Mary liked the dresses at the store, so she decided to try them on.

questions: The French _____ in Canada is somewhat different from that of France.
full_sentence: The French spoken in Canada is somewhat different from that of France.

questions: Ten _____ the thirty people we invited couldn't make it to our anniversary party.
full_sentence: Ten out of the thirty people we invited couldn't make it to our anniversary party.

questions: Jay hopes to get a part-time job _____ in a record shop.
full_sentence: Jay hopes to get a part-time job working in a record shop.

questions: The _____ of Normandy was an important battle.
full_sentence: The invasion of Normandy was an important battle.

questions: Fasten your seat belts because the plane will be taking _____ soon.
full_sentence: Fasten your seat belts because the plane will be taking off soon.

questions: The movie was just about _____ when we stepped into the theater.
full_sentence: The movie was just about to begin when we stepped into the theater.

questions: Though Tony was very afraid of heights his friend forced _____ to look down from the cliff.
full_sentence: Though Tony was very afraid of heights his friend forced him to look down from the cliff.

questions: Some students of English like to read novels _____ in simplified English.
full_sentence: Some students of English like to read novels written in simplified English.

questions: I really appreciate _____ gift you gave me for my birthday.
full_sentence: I really appreciate the gift you gave me for my birthday.

questions: John will be able to join us for lunch on Friday since he has no _____ plans.
full_sentence: John will be able to join us for lunch on Friday since he has no other plans.

questions: The sudden _____ that he couldn't pay because he'd forgotten his wallet put James in an awkward situation.
full_sentence: The sudden realization that he couldn't pay because he'd forgotten his wallet put James in an awkward situation.

questions: Would you mind _____ out your cigarette while I'm eating?
full_sentence: Would you mind putting out your cigarette while I'm eating?

questions: Stanley was her best friend so Alice knew she could _____ him with her secret.
full_sentence: Stanley was her best friend so Alice knew she could trust him with her secret.

questions: I wished Andrew luck _____ his history exam.
full_sentence: I wished Andrew luck on his history exam.

questions: Morgan's letter was _____, so he showed no one.
full_sentence: Morgan's letter was confidential, so he showed no one.

questions: The last thing Roger remembered _____ before passing out was his wife's voice.
full_sentence: The last thing Roger remembered hearing before passing out was his wife's voice.

questions: The criminal was _____ with the police and refused to speak anymore.
full_sentence: The criminal was uncooperative with the police and refused to speak anymore.

questions: Jenny _____ to a private university but decided to go to a cheaper public university.
full_sentence: Jenny was going to go to a private university but decided to go to a cheaper public university.

questions: I think Donna knows if my husband is giving me a surprise birthday party but she refused to say _____.
full_sentence: I think Donna knows if my husband is giving me a surprise birthday party but she refused to say anything.

questions: The police arrested Miss Rankin for shoplifting but then _____ decided not to press charges.
full_sentence: The police arrested Miss Rankin for shoplifting but then they decided not to press charges.

questions: You can't live in Canada as _____ as you can in Mexico.
full_sentence: You can't live in Canada as cheaply as you can in Mexico.

questions: Joe _____ in Boston for ten years when he moved to New Orleans.
full_sentence: Joe had lived in Boston for ten years when he moved to New Orleans.

questions: Dan walked out of the restaurant without _____ his check.
full_sentence: Dan walked out of the restaurant without paying his check.

questions: Brad was tired but _____ wasn't a place to sit down.
full_sentence: Brad was tired but there wasn't a place to sit down.

questions: The woman standing _____ of Kent is my cousin Laura.
full_sentence: The woman standing to the right of Kent is my cousin Laura.

questions: She was nervous in front of her literature class but she _____ the poem she'd written.
full_sentence: She was nervous in front of her literature class but she recited the poem she'd written.

questions: Jeanette was never able to speak Italian fluently no matter _____ she tried.
full_sentence: Jeanette was never able to speak Italian fluently no matter how hard she tried.

questions: Experts predict that the current economic slowdown will be followed by a period of _____ growth.
full_sentence: Experts predict that the current economic slowdown will be followed by a period of consistent growth.

questions: The mayor vowed to _____ public faith in his governing abilities.
full_sentence: The mayor vowed to renew public faith in his governing abilities.

questions: The government is trying to _____ the flow of people moving from the country into the cities.
full_sentence: The government is trying to curb the flow of people moving from the country into the cities.

questions: The forecast predicted heavy rain _____ by strong winds.
full_sentence: The forecast predicted heavy rain accompanied by strong winds.

questions: The bidding for the contract was highly _____.
full_sentence: The bidding for the contract was highly competitive.

questions: The _____ of an affordable electric vehicle will do much to alleviate air pollution.
full_sentence: The development of an affordable electric vehicle will do much to alleviate air pollution.

questions: _____ of the hotel will provide more comfortable rooms and better service for guests.
full_sentence: Renovation of the hotel will provide more comfortable rooms and better service for guests.

questions: Sound social policies, especially in education and health care, will help _____ poverty on a broad scale.
full_sentence: Sound social policies, especially in education and health care, will help reduce poverty on a broad scale.

questions: Exports _____ most of the nation's income.
full_sentence: Exports provide most of the nation's income.

questions: The cost of private education is often _____ the average family's ability to pay.
full_sentence: The cost of private education is often beyond the average family's ability to pay.

questions: The museum _____ to be one of the best in the world.
full_sentence: The museum claimed to be one of the best in the world.

questions: City officials are working on a plan to extend the park's _____.
full_sentence: City officials are working on a plan to extend the park's boundaries.

questions: The islands have been a problem for the three countries _____ sovereignty over them.
full_sentence: The islands have been a problem for the three countries declaring sovereignty over them.

questions: He was charged with theft after he was caught _____ the company's money into his own bank account.
full_sentence: He was charged with theft after he was caught diverting the company's money into his own bank account.

questions: _____ she was an educated native speaker of the language, her ability to write in English was not good.
full_sentence: Even though she was an educated native speaker of the language, her ability to write in English was not good.

questions: Business _____ whenever they lower their prices.
full_sentence: Business soars whenever they lower their prices.

questions: It took the computer less than half an hour to _____ the world chess champion.
full_sentence: It took the computer less than half an hour to defeat the world chess champion.

questions: Opening the machine plant _____ hundreds of badly needed jobs.
full_sentence: Opening the machine plant created hundreds of badly needed jobs.

questions: The restaurant was widely known for its delicious meals and _____ decor.
full_sentence: The restaurant was widely known for its delicious meals and tasteful decor.

questions: More _____ use of modern farming technology could revolutionize the agricultural sector.
full_sentence: More efficient use of modern farming technology could revolutionize the agricultural sector.

questions: The committee _____ the pros and cons of the deal for most of the afternoon.
full_sentence: The committee debated the pros and cons of the deal for most of the afternoon.

questions: The construction industry has played a key role in the _____ of the local economy.
full_sentence: The construction industry has played a key role in the success of the local economy.

questions: Only a small _____ of bacteria are actually harmful to people.
full_sentence: Only a small proportion of bacteria are actually harmful to people.

questions: _____ and enthusiastic teachers are essential to foster a love of learning in children.
full_sentence: Dedicated and enthusiastic teachers are essential to foster a love of learning in children.

questions: The chairman was charged with _____ the corporation of over 400 million dollars.
full_sentence: The chairman was charged with defrauding the corporation of over 400 million dollars.

questions: Employees _____ work more than forty hours in any five-day period will be paid the overtime rate for those hours.
full_sentence: Employees who work more than forty hours in any five-day period will be paid the overtime rate for those hours.

questions: Misuse of credit cards can cause terrible _____ problems.
full_sentence: Misuse of credit cards can cause terrible financial problems.

questions: Receiving the award was one of the most _____ moments of her life.
full_sentence: Receiving the award was one of the most memorable moments of her life.

questions: Proper nutrition is required for the human body to _____ at its best.
full_sentence: Proper nutrition is required for the human body to function at its best.

questions: The world's highest and most dangerous mountain has _____ many climbers' attempts to reach the summit.
full_sentence: The world's highest and most dangerous mountain has frustrated many climbers' attempts to reach the summit.

questions: The work itself was not difficult, but the sheer _____ of it had him worried.
full_sentence: The work itself was not difficult, but the sheer volume of it had him worried.

questions: As the job market becomes more _____, education and training become more important.
full_sentence: As the job market becomes more competitive, education and training become more important.

questions: A recent survey _____ that housing costs continue to skyrocket.
full_sentence: A recent survey indicates that housing costs continue to skyrocket.

questions: Widespread flooding is _____ for the rising cost of home insurance policies.
full_sentence: Widespread flooding is blamed for the rising cost of home insurance policies.

questions: The fog was so thick that driving became extremely _____.
full_sentence: The fog was so thick that driving became extremely dangerous.

questions: Not only was he a noted author, but also a _____ speaker.
full_sentence: Not only was he a noted author, but also a gifted speaker.

questions: Environmentalists have been _____ by many as being anti-technology and anti-progress.
full_sentence: Environmentalists have been branded by many as being anti-technology and anti-progress.

questions: The deadline was fast approaching, and he had not _____ finished even half of what he needed to.
full_sentence: The deadline was fast approaching, and he had not yet finished even half of what he needed to.

questions: The story of an ancient city in the jungle, filled with gold and jewels, turned out to be an elaborate _____.
full_sentence: The story of an ancient city in the jungle, filled with gold and jewels, turned out to be an elaborate hoax.

questions: Even _____ exposure to loud noises can permanently damage a person's hearing.
full_sentence: Even slight exposure to loud noises can permanently damage a person's hearing.

questions: The first _____ screen contains FAQ's, the most frequently-asked questions, about our software.
full_sentence: The first display screen contains FAQ's, the most frequently-asked questions, about our software.

questions: Once one has _____ the habit, smoking is very difficult to give up.
full_sentence: Once one has acquired the habit, smoking is very difficult to give up.

questions: _____ gets the highest grade point average will be the recipient of the scholarship.
full_sentence: Whoever gets the highest grade point average will be the recipient of the scholarship.

questions: A _____ number of people object to the government's attitude to immigration.
full_sentence: A considerable number of people object to the government's attitude to immigration.

questions: Having received several attractive offers from other companies, Jane decided to _____ her job.
full_sentence: Having received several attractive offers from other companies, Jane decided to quit her job.

questions: _____ an attempt to stagger working hours, most employees still arrive at 9 a.m.
full_sentence: Despite an attempt to stagger working hours, most employees still arrive at 9 a.m.

questions: After four years of working out of my home, I earn _____ I did before.
full_sentence: After four years of working out of my home, I earn twice as much as I did before.

questions: Prisoners of war sometimes _____ terrible hardships, and some never live through them.
full_sentence: Prisoners of war sometimes undergo terrible hardships, and some never live through them.

questions: The information is given orally; _____, they can read it in their booklets.
full_sentence: The information is given orally; in addition, they can read it in their booklets.

questions: Our banking clients want flexibility; _____, we provide ATMs for 24-hour use.
full_sentence: Our banking clients want flexibility; consequently, we provide ATMs for 24-hour use.

questions: It was such an excellent report that Mr. Shultz _____ the fact that it had been turned in late.
full_sentence: It was such an excellent report that Mr. Shultz overlooked the fact that it had been turned in late.

questions: Because of the weather conditions, we'd like to _____ this Friday's meeting until sometime next week.
full_sentence: Because of the weather conditions, we'd like to postpone this Friday's meeting until sometime next week.

questions: Adequate liquidity is maintained to meet the cash flow needs of _____ requirements.
full_sentence: Adequate liquidity is maintained to meet the cash flow needs of financial requirements.

questions: The young woman was so excited when she was _____ for an interview that she told everyone she knew.
full_sentence: The young woman was so excited when she was called in for an interview that she told everyone she knew.

questions: I believe that I could _____ a significant contribution to Exxone Corporation.
full_sentence: I believe that I could make a significant contribution to Exxone Corporation.

questions: _____ that you agree with our analysis of future economic trends, you have to invest your money in government bonds.
full_sentence: Providing that you agree with our analysis of future economic trends, you have to invest your money in government bonds.

questions: The job market _____ tight recently because of the depression.
full_sentence: The job market has been tight recently because of the depression.

questions: The pension plans cover only domestic employees; _____ international employees must make other arrangements.
full_sentence: The pension plans cover only domestic employees; consequently international employees must make other arrangements.

questions: Your compliance _____ this new policy is completely voluntary, but we think it is in the public interest that you do so.
full_sentence: Your compliance with this new policy is completely voluntary, but we think it is in the public interest that you do so.

questions: All of the tickets of the art _____ had been sold before the opening date.
full_sentence: All of the tickets of the art exhibit had been sold before the opening date.

questions: For full details of this special offer please _____ your local dealer.
full_sentence: For full details of this special offer please see your local dealer.

questions: We were presented with severe challenges; _____ we managed to record improved results.
full_sentence: We were presented with severe challenges; yet we managed to record improved results.
